title: Dash DFAF455GBAQ01 Deluxe Electric Air Fryer + Oven Cooker with Temperature Control, Non Stick Fry Basket, Recipe Guide + Auto Shut Off Feature, 6 qt, Aqua

HEALTHIER FRIED FOOD: Dash deluxe air fryer uses air crisp technology (instead of oil) to help reduce added fat by 70-80%, without sacrificing the flavor of your fried food (no more residual smell hours after you‚Äôve eaten)

6 QUART CAPACITY: The PERFECT appliance for picky eaters, large families, entertaining, or those who have busy schedules. 6qt basket is larger, and makes an abundance of appetizers, desserts, chicken wings, french fries, even baked goods, and all within minutes of setting the timer - it couldn‚Äôt be easier!

QUICK + EASY: Short on time? Simply load the large 6 qt capacity fryer basket, set the temp, and set the timer. Your food comes out crispy, guaranteed, EVERY TIME. And in less time than it takes to pre-heat your oven, making it more energy efficient

SAFER: The auto-shut off function prevents overcooking, and the cool touch housing and handle makes it safer to use. It‚Äôs so simple, even your kids can use it! (bonus, the nonstick fryer basket is dishwasher safe for even easier cleanup!)

INCLUDES: The 1700-watt Deluxe air fryer is backed by a 1-year manufacturer warranty and includes a recipe book and recipe database access (all non-electric parts are dishwasher safe). Available in Black, White, Red, and Aqua

reviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve been using a smaller version but was finding it wasn‚Äôt big enough for things I wanted to make. The size on this was perfect. I cooked a whole chicken and it came out beautiful. It took about 1 hour to cook and was tender. Easy to use, easy to clean and shipping was fast.

My biggest reason for wanting an air fryer was tofu, tofu is best fried but it sucks to add all that oil to something so healthy and boy did it ever deliver. We tossed it in corn starch and sprayed a little oil on it after shaking and it was so perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle. For this alone it is completely worth it.
Secondly, being a GF family we miss out on those yummy fried foods you usually get in restaurants and we‚Äôre very very pleased with the fried mushrooms, zucchini and onion rings. It even made frozen French fries just like a deep fryer.
It‚Äôs big but the size is perfect if you have a family. Oh and air fryer asparagus yummmm

reviews.reviewTitle: Absolutely love being able to have crispy foods quickly
reviews.reviewText: I decided to jump on the air fryer bandwagon and try this one out. I was happy with the size of the basket to hold enough food to feed my family of 4. I started with an easy recipe of just quartered red potatoes. They cooked quickly and were crispy. My 5 year old who often complains about the food I make said I should open a restaurant. That's high praise from her. I've cooked chicken and fish from frozen in the air fryer as well as reheated pizza for a crispy crust. The fryer is super easy to clean, which is important to me. I highly recommend it as long as you have the storage space for it as it is a fairly large appliance.

I have owned the Dash compact air fryer for a while. I love its small size but I did have some large air fryer envy. When I saw that Dash came out with a 6 quart, I went for it. I love being able to cook a whole chicken! The recipes that come along with this air fryer are amazing. The carnitas are a must try and have permanently upgraded my taco Tuesdays. I have heard about many air fryers having problems with peeling and smoking. I have not experienced these problems with either of my Dash air fryers.

We have made a ton of great sides and main course dishes with the awesome air fryer. My biggest suggestion is to always use fresh food. If it had already been cooked and frozen, use about half the suggest time. We love making our own fries at home and don‚Äôt feel so guilty anymore!! Def would suggest this for any home or as a gift!
I have used this air fryer several times and everything I have made comes out perfect. Fully cooked on the inside and crispy on the outside. It comes apart easily and clean up is a snap.
This air fryer is big. It is big enough to air fry a half rack of ribs with vegetables in less than 30 minutes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great and cooks all kinds of food
reviews.reviewText: I have made delicious meals and healthy snacks in this. I originally had the smaller one. Definitely go with the larger size. The accessories make a huge difference. They don't fit in the smaller version.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, with great results!
reviews.reviewText: So I've been wanting my family to eat healthier, but my husband is resistant to change. He is a man who loves all things fried...wings, french fries, burgers, corn dogs, etc. I decided to bite the bullet and I'm so glad I did! Be warned...this thing is HUUUGE! Other reviewers said it was big, but I didn't realize how big it was. Like, it's bigger than my 6qt InstantPot. Not a problem for me as I have the storage space, but something to consider for those with limited storage and counter top space. That being said, there are no other negatives. It's so easy to use, cleans super easy, and food comes out sooo good. So far I've made country potatoes and chicken cordon bleu, and my husband raved about how good they were, despite being way lower in fat than how I've previously made these dishes. I can't wait to make wings this weekend! Worth every penny.

I've been looking for nice air fryer and I chose my first air fryer very seriously. I am using Dash quick egg maker and very satisfying! So I chose Dash product again. Very easy to use and clean. Especially, I made chicken wings & French fries!! Amazing! Very quick and delicious, absolutely I would recommend this. Don't hesitate!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: Great option for frying foods without using unhealthy oils and messy clean-up (it's quiet too). Crab cakes in photo were evenly browned and good texture.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beware of the non stick coating!
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Sadly had to return this beautiful machine because the non stick coating bubbled and peeled after 3 weeks of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed with the quality of this product
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Great product but very poor, poor quality! I just received my Dash AF on April 14th and today is April 20th, six days of owning it and used it four of the six days and this is what it look like. I washed the AF out after every use, using dawn dish detergent and a microfiber cloth and this is the result. Very dissatisfied.

I purchased my first Air Fryer earlier this year and I enjoyed cooking in it, however, it had a small basket. So I purchased the 6 quart Dash. The only area of concern is related to cooking fish. Unlike my prior air fryer, the Dash releases cooking orders in the air as a result at the end of cooking my halibut my house smelled like fish. Future fish dishes will be cooked out side.

We used this tonight for french fries, the six quart basket is more than large enough. The fries were healthier and tastier. Clean-up was easy. We'll be using this appliance often.

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07GNSHPBQ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02__o00_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1#customerReviews
Great product until it just stopped working. Bought in March, used 3 times per week until it just stopped working in July.

After just a couple months of use - I can probably count 5 times if use. The black non stick coating of the fryer has started to peel out. I wish I could return it. I do not want the coating to end up on my food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, works as described - super convenient appliance
reviews.reviewText: We are really loving this air-fryer! The large basket size makes it perfect for even cooking, even for one or two people. I‚Äôm happy that I bought the larger size instead of the 3.7 qt. My husband is a meat eater, and I am not. We cook different foods for most meals. It‚Äôs easy to just wash it quickly in between, although adding a sheet of aluminum foil to the bottom of the pan enables us to just wash the basket between foods, since otherwise we would need to wait for the unit to cool down.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: My wife used it for the second time yesterday to cook a small, whole chicken. For some reason, the unit kept shutting off during cooking. It was not the time or a circuit breaker. After finally getting it cooked using the recomnended times and temps by the supplied book, the outside was burnt and the inside was pink. Not very impressed to say the least...

I was quite surprised by the size of this appliance. It is one of the largest I own, other than my small microwave that sits on my counter. The appliance will not fit into my cupboards so will have to remain on the counter when not in use. I used the fryer to cook chicken tenders and tater tots, and it worked well, however the "cookbook" that came with the appliance was more of an instruction manual and not an actual cookbook, even to cook the basic things, so I pretty much guessed the temperature and time, relying mainly on the food package directions for oven preparation. One suggestion I would give to the manufacturer/supplier is to include several of the parchment paper liners. I wondered about the mess and clean-up involved, so I Googled whether I could use parchment paper as a liner in the basket -- turns out that the liners are a big deal! Rather than waiting to purchase liners, I simply traced a 9" plate onto the parchment paper, cut it out, folded it in quarters, and used a hand-held paper punch to punch holes, then folded again and did the innermost section of the liner. It worked fantastic, and I will probably use homemade ones rather than store-bought ones which cost approximately ten cents each. Overall seems to be a great product, but is bigger than expected.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Ok for the price but...This fryer is really huge. It takes up a lot of space. It works well in a sense that it cooks the food. The Teflon is not great. I take good care of mine and the Teflon is coming off in some areas. It leaks terribly and that makes it smoke! It‚Äôs awful. I cleaned it well but that doesn‚Äôt help much because it continues to leak!

reviews.reviewTitle: Received Wrong Product that Looks Used
reviews.reviewText:
Received the wrong product and it looks like its been used. I ordered for the 6 quart airfryer and I received the compact version. I immediately noticed how the bag looked so big for the product. I pulled the product out and disappointed to see that it even looks like it's been used. See pictures for details.

Here is the link to the compact version for reference -- Dash Compact Air Fryer 1.2 L Electric Air Fryer Oven Cooker with Temperature Control, Non Stick Fry Basket, Recipe Guide + Auto Shut off Feature - Aqua https://www.amazon.com/dp/B075BCVSJZ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_apa_i_GYjvDbD8KJ1AW

My husband and I are extremely happy with our air fryer! We have made wings twice (better than any wing place we‚Äôve ate at) two different types of French fries, potatoe skins, and the kids chicken tenders and fish sticks (huge hit! Perfect amount of crispy!) it‚Äôs huge but perfect for a family of 6!
I LOVE this air fryer ! Its so easy, convenient, and the food tastes great! Ive used it almost every day since i got it to cook fish, chicken wings, and heat up frozen meals. Worth every penny!

The size of this air fryer is perfect. Not too big it can't be stored under the counter and big enough to cook whatever you are wanting to cook. It would fit a chicken in there. Makes french fries nicely! Easy to use and clean. Can't beat Amazon shipping.

The product was received on time, however it did malfunction. I contacted the seller, who responded quickly and sent a replacement out right away!! GREAT SELLER!!! Communication was clear and direct. Second product received worked splendidly, although the chef needs a little more experience with it! Definitely easy to use, clean and works as described.

reviews.reviewTitle: I liked it, until I asked the company to replace a defective part
reviews.reviewText: I really like this appliance. It worked great, just as I expected. After a couple of weeks of light use, making various recipes to figure out what its best use for me is, the basket's coating started chipping off. Clearly defective. So, I contacted the manufacturer to see if they could send me a new basket. In my email I praised the machine. They sent back a note saying they don't sell parts, but would send me a new unit, as a ONE TIME COURTESY, if I send my defective unit back. No apology, no further info. Just telling me that I wasn't able to BUY a replacement for the defective part. I was very puzzled by such strange customer service. So, I wrote back and pointed out I was not planning on buying a part from them to replace something defective they sold me. I let them know that was not a way to give me confidence in their company enough to purchase more items from them. They wrote back with no comment other than asking me for my address and the model number. I'm curious if I will in fact receive a new unit from them. Even if I do, their customer service leaves quite a bit to be desired. I like the the machine, if it had not chipped.

reviews.reviewTitle: the bydash website does not connect.
reviews.reviewText: I have only used it a couple of times; it seems to have less power then my previous, cheaper one (which died; it was a vendor replacement for another that died). I haven't given Dash much of a chance, but I was quite annoyed that Dash instructed me to register the product at a website (bydash) that does not connect.

I gave this fryer as a gift and my friend was so excited I had to write a review. She emailed me and called after trying it out, and has used it 5x since. She had never used one and we love ours so wanted to nudge her to use it. Fast, easy to feed her family and also really good looking design!

I love this because I don‚Äôt have to worry about cooking in oil, and it really makes delicious crispy chicken without breading. It‚Äôs easy to clean and easy to use.

However, I do still have to cook outside because it definitely makes my whole apartment smell like whatever I‚Äôm cooking. I‚Äôm also a little peeved that the instruction manual says specifically that they don‚Äôt recommend air frying sausages because of the excess oil, and I feel like an air fryer should be able to handle it :/

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Air Frier, but can sometimes leak from the basket.
reviews.reviewText:
Great product and fairly easy to use. It's convenient for meal prepping and makes cleanup faster than pan searing or oven cooking. Not to mention there's fast customer service to boot when it comes to getting a replacement. I had to get a replacement for my original machine due to some issues, however, these problems seem consistent and are cause by slight design flaws when it comes to the pullout basket.

For starters, if you intend on frequently using this to cook and meal prep, the basket's black colored plating has a good chance of chipping off. This isn't too bad, since the structural integrity of the frying basket is still intact and usable.
However, there is a more annoying design flaw overall with the pullout basket. There is a screw at the bottom of the container used to screw in a spacer piece separating the porous basket from the surrounding container. After a couple of usages, this spacer will has a chance of reshaping, allowing for oil or whatnot to slowly seep through the outer basket into the Frier itself. Cleanup becomes a bit more tedious because of this.

Overall, a good machine, with some minor problems, but still worth the price compared to other air fries of this size.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great product made even better
reviews.reviewText: I have been enjoying the Dash Compact Air Fryer for several months. The only drawback to this product was the size. Enter the Dash Deluxe Electric Air Fryer. The large capacity basket makes it possible to cook larger amounts. My first meal was fish and chips. I cooked the entire batch of potatoes first. While the crispy potatoes were keeping warm in the oven, I was able to air fry a large amount of fish. It was as delicious as fried fish and chips without the guilt. I enjoy this product so much that when I went to a family lunch recently, I brought it with me to demonstrate for everyone. They loved it!
Crisps food perfectly. I‚Äôve tried fish, veggie tater tots, and chicken. All turned out wonderful.

Loved how easy this is to use. I love fish and chips and cooking a frozen breaded piece of fish in the oven does not get it crispy and crunchy all the way round. This way I get a perfectly browned and crisped product. It is a huge appliance which lets me cook enough for the whole too.

I love my air fryer! I only rated 3 stars under the easy to clean section because my unit has a very sharp piece on th basket portion and I cut myself pretty bad when cleaning it for the first time. It seems to be a manufacturing defect. Not sure if I got the only one with a sharp edge or if this is a frequent problem with this unit.

It does not work. It does not get up to the temperature it is set on, even after being on for over an hour, each time we have tried it. There is also no customer service available if you have any problems with this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Basket came off causing the bottom pot that holds the hot oil to hit the floor, DANGEROUS!
reviews.reviewText: Loved this for the first month or so. Right around the time the 30 day return had expired, the basket came right off! The only reason I wasn't burned is because I only had a tablespoon of oil on the food, that's extremely dangerous! I let Amazon know and they directed me to the manufacturer. Do I want to go through that hassle? Probably not. Would I recommend this product or buy another one? Again, probably not! I love Amazon, I buy from them all the time, this is the first time I've been disappointed. If you purchase this, be careful. It's a great product otherwise.
Found this item to be overrated. I bought it primarily for making french fries..and to me all attempts failed to impress me. I gave the item away...

We just purchased this last March and we've been enjoying it. Today it stopped working for no reason. we have it on the same spot plugged in on the same outlet. We also only plug it on an outlet whenever we used it and we leave it unplugged all the time. This is very disappointing!

reviews.reviewTitle: The space egg changed my life
reviews.reviewText:
It's big. Bigger than you think. Do you see those Hamiltons? This guy is large. Still, it's recommended you only cook up to 1.5lbs of meat at a time.

I've cooked chicken breasts with minimal prep and they were really juicy and fantastic. I've even cooked frozen breaded fish and they came out with a crunchy breading. It takes 10-30 minutes to cook, depending on what you're doing.

It doesn't get too hot. It doesn't get too messy. It's giant but attractive on the counter. It'll change the way you cook.

reviews.reviewTitle: Timer gets stuck and machine won‚Äôt shut off when done
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Was great for the first two uses and then the timer stopped working. If you don‚Äôt pay attention your food will burn as it doesn‚Äôt shut off because the timer gets stuck around the 8 min mark.

I bought this a few months ago and it worked right out of the box. I put it on the shelf for a few months and then took it out to use it again today and it doesn't work. No heat at all. The timer goes, and dings, and everything is still frozen and the air fryer is cold. I'm so disappointed!
great appliance ---- wish i had this long ago----makes my meals so simple to prepare .

Bought this fryer for my husband for Father's Day. We love it! Last year we purchased a rotisserie as a healthier method to cook that would still be tasty. And it was great...but the clean-up is horrendous and the uses were pretty limited. This air fryer provided the same healthy cooking option but its uses are so far limitless. We've done fresh chicken breasts to frozen cordon bleu, frozen shrimp to fresh cod, and the gambit of fresh veggies to my husband's favorite - tator tots. The result has been incredible. Both fresh chicken and fish is golden crispy on the outside while maintaining juicy goodness inside. Even the delicate cod was suitable for the fryer. The cook time is only slightly less than the oven but the ability to move the fryer outside allows me to cook without heating up the kitchen. A bonus during the summer. We have used it almost every day for the last two months and have yet to find anything it cannot do. Super satisfied and highly recommend this product. Clean-up is a breeze. I lightly spray the inner basket with Pam spray and all it needs is a wipe of a sponge and hot soapy water. I clean after every use to avoid flavor transfer.

Something happened with the shipping and it arrived later than it should have. The product itself though, LOVE IT! This thing is amazing. I can make my kids a fast meal that actually tastes good without the grease or mess. It is so easy to use and cleans without any trouble. It is big enough to use for a family of 5 with no waiting around. I am so glad that I bought this machine.

as noted in my rating everything worked as advertised . however, for whatever particular cause, it imparts a plastic-ky and burnt rubber aroma to the food which was unacceptable especially with my wife who literally said she couldn't stomach. hopefully the manufacturer will find a solution to this problem.

If you are cooking for more than one person then don't buy this product. Cooking times are twice as long as recipes say. Will only cook a single layer of food at a time even though it advertises being able to cook a basket full. Dont buy this garbage

I do love they way it air fries chicken wings and cooks steak to a juicy perfection, however; it's starting to break down too easily. The lock part where you disconnect the top layer from the bottom is already loose only after 2 months.

I went to take the meat out and the bottom part unlocked on its own and fell off as I was taking it out to get the chicken out. I do use it a few times a week but I didn't except it to start breaking down so quick.

Great for cooking lots of foods, just not as sturdy as I'd hope it would be.
HAD THE COMPACT MODEL AND NEEDED A LARGER MODEL FOR MORE FOOD. COOKING ALL SORTS OF THINGS IN IT AND SO FAR HAVE NO COMPLAINTS.
Love this air fryer! It's my first one and it works like a dream. Nice and crispy with little to no oil in a fraction of the time. Very easy to clean as well.

Love our new air fryer! We rent s basement and there is no stove range so we‚Äôre always trying to find new ways to cook food in a reasonable amount of time. Because you don‚Äôt need to use oil to cook there is not really any mess, which is my favorite part. The first thing we made was sweet potato wedges and they came out way better than when I bake them in our toaster oven. They had the perfect amount of crisp!

reviews.reviewTitle: Non stick coming off, screws coming loose
reviews.reviewText: I really like this air fryer, I love the way the food turns out but I have only used it maybe 6 times and the non stick is coming off everywhere. I'm really careful when I wash it, I only use a wash cloth and always hand wash it. I also found a screw in my food which I almost swallowed the other day that popped off the handle part I guess when I was shaking the food. The other screw fell off somewhere too so now have to try and find screws to fit so I can put the basket back on the handle. I'm really disappointed at how cheaply made this is even though I love how the food turns out.

I don't use this for too many different things. Honestly I think Chicken strips and french fries are the most common. Not that I don't think that it could handle more just that I don't cook a wide variety of things. I think it is worth it just for what I use it for especially the French fries as I cut up 8 yellow potatoes, a little olive oil, paprika or whatever spices you want, and just let it go. Shake the basket a couple of times then all good. I usually take half out then let the other half cook for an extra 5 as some in my house like softer and some like crispier. Someday I will give the recipe book a try!

I really love this! You can cook without any fat, so its much healthier. I especially love making Chicken wings in this. Turns out VERY crispy just like you fried them. Regular potatoes made as fries do not turn out that great, but frozen fries are sooo crispy and delicious. I haven't made too much in it yet, but plan on it.

So granted I have had this thing for less than a day but color me impressed! I also have the skinny taste air fryer cookbook because I want to make some tasty stuff that‚Äôs also low calorie. I like the funky color because none of our appliances match anyway. I‚Äôve accepted then and now just buy things in strange colors on purpose ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

I have an actifry from when those things first came out and the turning arm broke anything that went into it. So it has been retired and replaced with this new hotness.

So for the space egg‚Äôs maiden voyage (as coined by another reviewer) I made a low calorie apple crumble from the book mentioned earlier. Prep was super easy and into the egg my 4 apple halves went. The recipe said 27 minutes, I think I could have cut the time shorter but they cane out ooey gooey and delicious.

Then there was clean up to do. I was worried because some of the sugar flour mixture got on the tray and the basket but after some dawn and just a sponge everything came off in record time.

I really look forward to making more recipes with this and am very pleased with its initial performance.

I would recommend this to family and friends.
I've been thinking about getting an air fryer for a while and finally gave in. Works amazing and we've used it almost every day for the last 2 weeks

UPDATED: I have now cooked with this and I am obsessed. My family recently "fired" me from cooking because I'm so bad at it, but they have eaten everything I've made with this air fryer and loved every bite. It is so easy to use that it made me into a good cook. A true miracle!

2 additional thoughts -

1. I ordered the white and the mint arrived. Doesnt match anything in my kitchen, so that's a bummer. But it is a nice color.
2. It is waaaaay bigger than I had envisioned! Not a problem for me in the end, but if you have limited storage in your kitchen, check the dimensions carefully before you order.
The star system has improved. Five star item no complaints. I actually like how fast you can cook with this thing. Turkey burgers are the best. Pretty slick item.

I love my new air fryer it came as promised and after taking it out of the box I just had to run some water on it and it was ready to go. I works wonderful and cooks it the time my electric over takes to preheat. So far everything has come out wonderfully done a whole chicken in about an hour, fries took only minutes to cook. I love the red color and its size is great for us I haven't had to do more that the basket holds yet. I feel the key to this fryer is because of its size I can not put it in a cabinet so it sits on my counter top which is a good thing because it reminds me to use it. So appliances that you buy you put away and forget you have it so it never gets use, like our deep fryer witch I have gotten rid of now that I have the air fryer, its better for us and we are now eating less grease food. Would recommend this fry to all my family and friends.

I bought this because of the good reviews and large capacity. I will admit that when I first got it, I was not sold on it. The first thing I made was broccoli and it was all dried out (due to me not knowing what I was doing). Rather than get discouraged, I went onto Pinterest and researched how to cook with an air fryer and tried some recipes. That made all the difference, and I am now sold on it. I do a lot of weekend batch cooking, and adding this device to my Instapot has taken the meals I prep to the next level. The only drawback is how big it is - but I understand it needs to be to get the capacity I was looking for. I donated a bunch of unused pots and pans, and was able to make room in my cupboard. I use it almost every day, and so far have had no issues with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It has it's own permanent spot on the counter because we use it all the time!
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with this air fryer! It is so easy to use and it is easy to clean. I held off on buying one for a long time because I didn't think I really needed one- spoiler alert! You do! Everything tastes like it was fried in oil but it wasn't! I also really appreciate being able to toss a snack like frozen egg rolls into the air fryer and have them come out super crispy without have to heat the oven up for just a couple small things. Hot dogs and bratwurst taste amazing when heated in the air fryer- just like they had been grilled! This air fryer is huge and big enough for my family of 6, I am so glad I purchased it and I wish I had gotten it sooner. This is one appliance that has earned it's own permanent spot on my counter, it does not get put away in a cabinet!

Researched a lot of air fryers and decided to purchase this one, it didn‚Äôt have many reviews yet since the largersize was newer on the market. I‚Äôve had mine for a couple of months and love it! I was reluctant to buy another appliance and this one is large to store but unlike some small appliances I am using this one a couple times a week. It‚Äôs fairly quiet, easy to clean and food comes out crispy. The only thing I think could improve this air fryer is there isn‚Äôt a way to stop it before the time you set it up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice appliance. Great wings. PROBLEM gasket, should I return?
reviews.reviewText:
This appliance is large. I watched the video with the specific view to comparing the size of the fryer to a human (a small female), so I wasn't shocked. But to have an air fryer worth bothering with seems like this size is the ticket. I like to cook for two adults with average appetites and a love for veg. This will make veg for two, maybe wings for 3? Looks great with my antique (still in use) minty green 1950's appliances.

PROBLEM: There is a plastic nut with a screw on the bottom of the outer basket. This nut has a silicone cover that serves as a gasket which also keeps the non-stick basket from scraping on the bottom or sides of outer solid "basket" and should keep things leaking out of the bottom. No matter how many times I replace this cover/gasket over the nut and tighten the screw again it ALWAYS COMES OFF DURING COOKING. Which means it leaks oil etc. inside the appliance and on any surface you place the removable unit outside the fryer. Additionally if you aren't aware this gasket could be (and almost was) washed away in the sink more than once and it is a pain to replace EVERY TIME, plus the oil spills. Is my unit defective?

Otherwise a useful and quick kitchen appliance that has pulled it's weight in the past month. I'm not even a "wing person" (is that a thing?) but this makes some killer wings with a dry spice rub and then dredged in corn starch. Simple and delicious.

Wings the true star so far, we like to entertain and they have been a universal hit. We do not eat or reheat much processed food so this is all straight home cooking. I live in potato country (farms all around,) and I will say that if you cut fresh potatoes and then "fry" in here with a small amount of oil you will have something directly in between french fries and the best oven roasted crispy potatoes you have ever eaten. Not actual french fries, but leaning that way. Very tasty though, much less oil to purchase, and MUCH LESS "fried" odor in your house.

Buy it if you have enough storage and want wings or "fried" potatoes. But the gasket is a hassle and a problem not everyone will enjoy.

reviews.reviewTitle: It stopped working in less than 2 months
reviews.reviewText:
I initially was very happy with the airfryer however it didn't last very long
Not even 2 months went by and it just stopped working. I tried to return it to Amazon but was told I could only return within a month. So now I'm about to call the manufacturer because it has a 1 year warranty.
Cooked chicken tenders quick and crispy

reviews.reviewTitle: One purchase that my husband actually doesn't mind I spent money on.
reviews.reviewText:
This thing has been used most out of all my kitchen appliances in the last 3 months. I use this more than my microwave now. I actually may even use it *as* my microwave because I reheat almost everything in it‚Äîfries, pizza, chicken, sandwiches...the list goes on.
I know the purpose is to cook food from the beginning, but it's so helpful for reheating too, so I wanted to mention that.
The basket is very large; I can fit a whole chicken in it, but that would be ridiculous b/c it'd never cook the whole way without resetting the 30 minute timer over and over.
It's super easy to clean, too. I just take it out and place it in the dishwasher. Much easier than trying to clean all of the little holes and slots by hand.
Nothing seems to stick beyond easy removal. I've cooked everything from frozen salmon (nope, the skin doesn't stick either) to fried chicken.
The blower is pretty strong, so I wouldn't put anything with loose toppings on it (pizza), but for reheating, pizza does fine.
The unit itself is rather large. The only place I can store it is on top of my fridge.
It does put off some heat. I walked out of my kitchen and back in after using it to cook various different items and could definitely feel the difference, but it does not get hot enough to damage its surroundings.
I place it on my cooktop (see picture for reference) for cooking.
I highly recommend this guy.

Came very well packaged and is very easy to use and clean. Have only used it once and my attempt at chicken tenders was not that great. My in home critic's would have liked them to be more crispy. Keep in mind it does require quite a bit of space.

I was very glad to join the air fry bandwagon with this Dash Air Fryer. I have mostly used it for frozen foods such as egg rolls and chicken tenders and fish fillets so far. I use parchment paper to help with the clean up. In some cases it comes out better with no oil at all. Definitely a healthy cooking alternative. I want to see how it does with fried chicken and shrimp. Only downside is that it is a substantial sized appliance so you need some counter space in your kitchen to use it. Also pretty heavy to move from counter to kitchen cabinet when not in use.

I live the low-carb lifestyle. I wanted something to cook hot wings and after thinking about a deep fryer, I decided to give this unit a try. I started out with a 10# bag of wings from Sam's. I used Franks Red Hot and butter for the sauce. After overdosing on hot sauce I decided to try Tyson Buffalo Wings from Sam's or BJ's. I like my wings crispy. I spray the pan with olive oil spray to prevent sticking. 10-12 wings fit with a single layer. I cook the wings at full power for 14 minutes (from frozen), flip and cook another 12 minutes. They are extra crispy!!! A lot of times I don't use hot sauce at all. Cleaning is simple. I soak the whole pan and basket in hot water with dish liquid. Then I run a dish brush around inside. I let it sit a while then rinse and repeat one time. Clean! I'm very happy with my wing machine and use it often.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality no quality control from amazon
reviews.reviewText: Non stick peeled off in basket. Basket slipped off and had not grease all over my kitchen floor. Sorry my return window had ended. Think Amazon should honor the return since I have been a Prime customer for a lot of years. Offer longer return window on items that I don't use every day.
Just got it today so will update if anything happens but... as soon as it arrived we cleaned it and made some chicken wings that came out amazing

My first air fryer was given to us for Christmas. It was a well known brand in air fryers, and after 4.5 months of moderate use it just stopped working in the middle of cooking potatoes. Turns out it was a blessing in disguise, because I ended up getting this one on a lightning deal for an awesome price. It's so much better than that one was! It's simple to use, cooks food evenly and much faster that the other one we had. It's also so much easier to clean and keep clean, and bonus for the pretty mint green color! If I wanted to just nitpick I'd say it'd be nice to have something on the bottom to wrap the cord up on, but honestly that is literally the only way I could imagine to improving this great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great, just buy a different brand
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE this!! We use is at least 1-2 nights a week.
However. The plastic on the outside is warping. The pan no longer fits correctly, the teal plastic is warping and changing. Soon we will not be able to use it as a result.
I love this product. But they need to invest in higher quality material to make it. I would def. Buy an air frier again, just not from this company.

reviews.reviewTitle: It‚Äôs a great 6 qt. Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: This is a simple to operate air fryer, 6 qt. design that makes the food crisp and delicious. I first bought a Nuwave and used it once and returned it because the food took on a burnt plastic taste. The basket always fell out of the drawer too. This Dash is well made, doesn‚Äôt impart any smells to the food, it cooks evenly and it‚Äôs quiet. Some air dryers are loud due to fans but this one is pretty quiet. I would like a 60 minute timer, but I just roll it back if necessary. Don‚Äôt force the timer, turn off heat and let it finish ticking away. It may not have the bells and whistles but it‚Äôs good size and it cooks great. I did chicken wings, tater tots, sweet potato fries that were frozen, made everything delicious.

My husband complained that this would just be another thing to sit on the counter and never get used, but we LOVE it and use it almost every night. The food cooks quickly and taste wonderful. It's such a healthy alternative. And the customer service is excellent. I did have a small scratch on the inside pan, and I contacted customer service and they immediately sent me another one. I have not had any other issues, but I feel confident if I do, they will take care of me. They stand behind their product! You won‚Äôt be disappointed with this air fryer.
This picture shows my fried pork chops on my first try. They were so good.

I love this thing! I have made everything from crispy chicken thighs and jalape√±o poppers to corn on the cob and cauliflower in it, and everything has been absolutely delicious! I highly recommend it. My only complaint is that the little bit of oil I use sometimes gets baked on during the cooking process, and it's a bit hard to clean out. When that happens, I just make sure to let some baking soda paste sit on it for a bit before I wipe it down and clean it as usual.

I am new to air frying. This is my first air fryer and I'm loving it. It is large enough that I can make larger batches and not have to do several. It is easy to use and very easy to clean. Easy cleaning is a plus with me! I hate kitchen gadgets that are hard to clean! This air fryer seems to cook quickly and evenly if I follow the directions correctly....I'm still learning. I would recommend it to anyone!

reviews.reviewTitle: Almost perfect, non stick surface is already chipping off
reviews.reviewText:
I really do love this air fryer. It is perfect when I want to cook something but don't want to heat up the whole kitchen in the hot Texas heat. It's so easy to use and you can cook just about anything in it.

My biggest complaint is that the non-stick coating on the inside is starting to chip, and I haven't had it but a couple months. I have been very careful not to use anything metal to move the food in and out. Plus, it isn't terribly non stick. It is a little disappointing that it is starting to have this kind of problem so quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm in love with this air fryer!
reviews.reviewText: Wow! I'm so so happy I caught this as a deal of the day. I've been using it for everything. I made wings and omg. I'll never spend money to eat out on wings ever again. For after school snacks I've made mozzarella sticks, pizza bagels, corn dogs, etc. I'm low carb, so this has been great to also cook meat and I'll be trying Brussel sprouts and asparagus next. I'm very pleased with my purchase. It's also one of the bigger ones I've looked into at 6qts. You can cook an entire chicken.

Dear Amazon team
I got the fryer Dash DFAF455GBWH01 Deluxe Electric Air Fryer + Oven Cooker with Temperature Control, Non Stick Fry Baske, which i could not use because they send me 110v power and in my country the power supply is 220 v, i contacted Amazon and they advise me to use converter with it, i have ordered yesterday for the converter 2019 upgraded ALL IN ONE 2000 W TRAVEL ADAPTER, will that work with the fryer please advise

reviews.reviewTitle: Great but basket ends up peeling:(
reviews.reviewText: It‚Äôs a great machine, works great and chicken is crispy and beautiful but the basket has been peeling off:( I always soak it a little bit and clean with a sponge afterwards but I‚Äôve noticed lately that it is peeling and sticking on the food.
the temperature button never worked, I had to return this purchase
Just got this took it out of the box, cleaned it and 35 min later we had dinner , the wings were crispy and delicious, easy to use and clean... going to do a whole chicken!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Appears to have been used previously.
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I just got this and parts are floating around in the box, no instructions were included, and it's a little wet inside the basket. Gross.

Works pretty well so far. I've used it a bunch of times for chicken tenders, coconut shrimp, roasted brussel sprouts, chicken wings. Max temp is 400 degrees, which is enough for most things. The timer keeps going even if you pull out the drawer (which automatically turns off the oven/fan) so if you want to turn it off early just let the timer run out and leave the drawer detached. Cleaning it is probably the worst part. The instructions say clean after every use but if you're just putting mostly dry items in, it could be used a few times. The bottom section of the drawer has a button to prop up the basket, which leaks a bit when you're soaking with water/soap or if you get a layer of grease on the bottom, it could leak into the bottom of the oven. Only 1 screw holds that in but doesn't seem to be much of a problem, just have to be aware of it. I got the machine in white, which seems to be turning a little yellow around the sides that meet the drawer. Holds up to 2 lbs of food but recommended amount is 1lb.

We purchased this air fryer mainly for french fries. It does do an OK job, in a convenient way and short time... But your fries come out more baked than fryed tasting. I achieve the same results using my conventional oven and laying the fries on a baking sheet (after I spice and oil them.)
My pros:
- easy to use
-easy to clean
-just ok tasting food
My cons:
-extreamly bulky, huge may I say
-just ok tasting food

If you fry a lot, this is probably a good option to eat healthier. Thought about replacing it with the smaller version but the flavor is not there. For us, it's a no go, sent it back.
The grease leaked out of the pan into the bottom of the air fryer.
It broke after 5 uses. The heat element stopped working. I tried contacting Dash and they did not get back to me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy it, you won't be disappointed!!!
reviews.reviewText: I love fried food but recently decided to eat healthier and go to the gym. When I heard about an air fryer, I knew I had to get one. I'm my search I came across this one with great reviews. The fact that I was able to get it in red and it was large enough for a whole chicken, sealed the deal. I made chicken wings and French fries and was amazed that it was crispy as if I fried it in oil. Here's to a healthy life without compromising some of my favorite fried foods.

I‚Äôm so impressed with this product. Super easy to use - seriously thought my sister would not be able to get over the fact that I paid half of what she paid for a well know brand at Bed Bath and Beyond. Not only was this air fryer easy to use, it also was super easy to clean up. The brand my sister had actually made a lot of noise and was getting boxed up to be returned by the end of the evening.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to use and cleans up very fast and easily
reviews.reviewText:
I received today and fixed some fries in it, works beautifully. Plan on using it for a lot of things. Love you don't need to use any oils and it air fryes to a golden brown. Very easy to clean and use.

I will update if there are any problems later after more use.

this is the only one i ever had and used, being it is large as well as has a temp control dial of a complete range, (others i looked at didnt have the fine tuning temperature this one can do) and this one was at a great low cost when i got mine, it was well worth getting this one... timer and temp control and large, what more is needed on these air fryers.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far, so good, but this thing is HUGE!
reviews.reviewText: I have only used it once, but it did a fantastic job. It has a MUCH larger profile than expected, so it takes up a good bit of space on the counter. Still, for the job it did, I am really pleased so far. Makes sweet potato fries SUPER crunchy and that was the goal. Trying to eat healthier by avoiding oils and sugars and STILL have some crunchy texture to foods without that, so far so good! We'll see how long the nonstick coating lasts. I registered mine to double the warranty, so hopefully the company will make it good if there ARE any issues.
Stopped working after 2 uses. Smelled burning plastic. Will return ASAP.

Buy a 6 qt air fryer if it‚Äôs for 3-4 people. Otherwise it‚Äôll take you a few times to cook stuff. Love this cooking device very much. Cleaning is also not a hassle. Make sure to wipe off the extra grease off baskets before washing inside and use s soft sponge to clean it.

I‚Äôve been skeptical for some time now about air fryers but I‚Äôm so glad this one popped up on my amazon home page! It is ridiculously easy to use and the results are great!! You will not be disappointed at all in this fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: It was great until it quit working
reviews.reviewText: I have had this air fryer for 2 months and used it about a dozen times AND it quit working. $99 down the drain.
Love the product but the dash emblem wiped of within a week. The casing in the basket do not stay together so I have to pick it up with oven mitts. I'm very disappointed would not order again

I nearly sent this back after buying it on a whim, and being put off by its large size. A friend convinced me to give it a try, so I did. It has been worth clearing out my kitchen cupboard to make some space for it! I have young kids and this makes meal time much easier. It‚Äôs like a convection oven, but without the long wait to preheat. It cuts cooking time in half. A real asset at this stage of my life is being able to turn frozen foods into cooked and ready in just a few mins. So far I‚Äôve made all sorts of things with this air fryer, including a roast chicken - and I‚Äôm a convert. I love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sick of things that don't work as they should
reviews.reviewText:
The H of this duo says that we have an unreasonable expectation that things will work as they are intended to work. He's likely right but I point out the number of things that do work and its pretty impressive. (Thank you China)

For all I know, this does work. We never got to find out because the bleeping door won't open. We read the instructions, we looked at the pictures and then we read the instructions again.

IT WON'T OPEN.

Sending it back.

Amazingly cooks/fries food easily and almost better than greasy oil frying. Food taste crisp & great. Love Love Love that I don't have to deal with the oily mess to clean or dispose of. Kitchen smells better also without the hot oil cook smell, only wonderful food smells! But be aware the 6qt Dash is BIG! You will have to have counter space for it. If you have a family of 4 or more or want to be able to do other cooking (like a whole chicken), this is the size Air Fryer for you. If you are single or small family or just want to do small batches of fried foods/appetizers then I highly suggest the smaller size Dash

Does everything expected and more. My kids love the food better than the oil fryer and its so easy with no mess. There is a lot of different kinds out there but if you are going to buy one, BUY THIS ONE. Large capacity too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after one month! Replacement had frayed wires!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this while it worked. Used it 3 times and then the 4th time a VERY LOUD noise started to emit - like a fan banging up against housing. Luckily, was within return window so ordered a replacement. Unpacked the replacement and the front housing fell off - exposing a FRAYED wire! Didn't even plug that unit in. I really liked the looks of this brand and loved the way it air fried the first couple times I used it. VERY disappointed that I know feel I need to search for a different brand as I don't trust this brand to work. I will say the 2nd replacement shipment was NOT packed well - no padding or styrofoam at all. This may have caused the housing to come apart. I am also bummed that now two huge plastic machines are headed to the plastics graveyard. From an environmental standpoint, that makes me angry as well.

I can't thank my sister enough for showing me what a Air fryer was!! I bought mine on deal of the day! I have used it almost everyday! Bought a Red and an Aqua for my daughters!! They LOVE theirs too!
I spray a coat of Pam or Canola oil spray on it so the meat and veggies don't stick to the pan. I made wings in it the other night and they came out tender and delicious in 30 minutes vs 1.5 hours in the oven! This is the way to go and it uses less current!

Product was great. Basket was much bigger than expected - able to make 5/6 cups of veggies at a time. The only thing is that the temperature isn‚Äôt super easy to control, as it it just a dial. Hard to be precise. Super easy to clean!
Best purchase I have made in a while! I made chicken parmigiana in it and it was sooooo good! The outside was nice and crispy and the inside was so juicy and tender!

reviews.reviewTitle: Where has this been all of my life?!
reviews.reviewText: Guys... cheese sticks in 6 min flat. LIFE. CHANGING! I love that when my kids want something that requires the oven to preheat and sit in there for 25 min, I can have it ready in 5-8 min for them. This is easily one of the best purchases I've made in a while and even my husband agrees. ;)

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely has earned a space on the counter.
reviews.reviewText: Very pleased with this air fryer. I really like that the control is a dial vs. a digital readout as I think it will hold up longer with heat exposure. Everything I've made so far has had great results. Following their recommendation to pre-heat does make in difference in the crispness of the food. It does take up a good amount of space on the counter, but as I am using it several times a week, it's earned its place.
Works good! Would have given it 5 stars, but the packaging sticker that was on the basket left a gooey film that I can not get off

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Very disappointed. Had this about two months now, The first day we bought it, the bottom fell out from under it. I thought it was a error on my part so I ignored it. But it has happened two more times now. The second time it happened, my three year old was in the kitchen and it could have easily burned her because it fell apart. The third time it happened it fell apart and literally flew about 5 feet across the kitchen floor! Praise God my 1 year old baby wasn't by my feet like normal. When I tried to put the pan back in the air fryer, the bottom part was all bent up because of it flying across the kitchen and now will not close. Dangerous and disappointed.

This sucker is huge! If storage is an issue for you like it is for me, you might want to look at a smaller unit! I haven‚Äôt decided if I‚Äôm going to keep it or not. Works well though - threw some frozen egg rolls in and they cooked in about 10 min and came out crispy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for veggies, fries, meat, even bread!!
reviews.reviewText: Great for most anything that doesn‚Äôt have a sauce or gravy. I‚Äôve cooked and reheated bread, fries, roasted veggies is my favorite and chicken, fish, hot dogs and burgers!! Only one thing to clean and it‚Äôs easy to clean. Especially pleased it cooks frozen rolls and great for roasted veggies.. Not good for baked apples or meat in a sauce or gravy. I need a rack to cook more at one time.

I used this Dash Air Fryer once and it cracked my countertop. I contacted Dash to ask if they would provide help to fix the damage. They only offered a replacement and one other Dash appliance. My priority was to fix the damage, not the offer of a replacement. I returned the appliance to Amazon and now in the process of getting the quartz countertop repaired; with no assistance from Dash. Dash gave me the impression they did not believe me, stating this had never happened. Why in the world would I choose to go after Dash to get my quartz repaired????? if it wasn't their appliance that caused it. Very disappointed in Dash and will never buy another Dash product. NOTE: there are no warnings in the instructions of excessive heat underneath the appliance, only around the appliance; which I followed all instructions. Also, I plan on contacting the FTC and BBB to file a complaint.

I've had this a month now. I now use this more than my oven. Wings are fantastic in this. We loved them so much that we made them 4 days in a row. Chicken tenders, homemade fries, frozen foods, vegetables. This is definitely not a kitchen gadget that won't get used, which is what I initially thought might happen. I love it! It does take up a lot of counter space, that's the only annoying thing about it.

This is my first air fryer. I use it a few time a week. Meats are nicely seared, moist and juicy. I can't complain about the end results. I do have a couple of complaints however. The coating on the basket has begun to chip off. I'm hoping it's safe to use that way. Also the plastic clip that covers the basket release broke early on.

Couldn‚Äôt wait to give this a try. The first issue is the sticker on the front of the unit. Would not completely come off. The second issue is the plastic smell and taste. The food cooks great but has a horrible plastic after taste. My daughter won‚Äôt even eat when I use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best air fryer and customer service around!
reviews.reviewText: We really love our air fryer. I was a little skeptical about the air fryer craze, but it‚Äôs even better than reported. It is so easy to use. It‚Äôs very intuitive to use. We have been using it every day since it arrived. Everything has turned out so good. And it‚Äôs so easy to clean. The company‚Äôs customer service better than most other companies. A real winner.

My cousin told me to invest in an air fryer and my son told me it was a waste of money. This is probably the best investment I have made all year. It cooks leftovers like it was made that day. I am so amazed at the results of cooking with this. This will not end up on the shelf. I will use this about every day. It is a lot larger than expected but it is well worth it.

While I have only cooked 4-5 meals since the purchase, I am very happy with the product so far. It cleans up quickly. It fits the perfect amount of food for a family of 3. I enjoy the fact there is no pre-heating time as there is with our large propane oven, especially during the summer months. I have made bang bang shrimp, chicken burgers and many frozen pre-made items such as tots, sweet potato fries, fish sticks and chicken nuggets.

This air fryer was used twice. The first time(the day of purchase), it sounded like a helicopter trying to take off when it started heating up. The second time(a week later) it heated up for less than five minutes and then it died, never to turn back on again. I've already started the return process, but I'm so disappointed. Guessing that somehow the fan was knocked off center during either manufacturing or transit. Unfortunately, I don't seem to be the only person who's experienced this, so...... bummer, Dash.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use. Good food. Bad design
reviews.reviewText:
We love the air fryer. It works great. Except it says that it is dishwasher safe. However, the Teflon immediately started coming off of the fry basket. I reach out to customer support and they are sending us an entire new Air Fryer instead of just replacing the basket. That's fine but what am I going to do with two? Should be able to just replace the the basket.

If it says it's dishwasher safe, it should be able to withstand a dishwasher and not destroy the teflon.
Only had it for a month before it died. 1 day out of the return window. I appreciate Amazon working with me and accepting the return. I loved it while it worked it was just short lived.
This is so easy to use. Plug it in, put your food in, turn a couple of dials and that‚Äôs it, the machine does the rest. It‚Äôs not loud. It‚Äôs easy to clean. The food tastes great and crispy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Timer is insanely loud and annoying!!
reviews.reviewText: Guess it works alright, but the timer is EXTREMELY LOUD!!!! I can‚Äôt stand to use it and hear that endless deafening tick-tick-tick-tick-aaahhhh! Totally drives me crazy!!! Return shipping was too expensive or it would have gone back. Giving this thing away as soon as I find a friend who doesn't mind the annoying noise of this gadget.

I love kitchen gadgets, but I was not expected to love the air fryer as much as I do! We use it at least twice a week, sometimes almost daily! It has become a quick replacement for our oven, as it heats up and cooks faster, and does not heat up the whole house. It crisps things up perfectly!

I use this air fryer almost daily in my household- it is easy to clean and food is crispy and delicious! It is BIG. So big that I almost sent it back, but Im so glad I decided to keep it. I have 2 little boys who love anything fried, so this was a great way to give them some of what they love, but still give them something a little healthier.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only 1 month old and the teflon is peeling off the fryer basket
reviews.reviewText: We loved this air fryer, but after using it for 1 month the telfon is peeling off the fryer basket in a large circle. We are always very careful when we clean it, we usually soak the basket in warm water first to soften anything that is cooked on. We have never used any metal utensils in the basket and have only scrubbed it very lightly with a plastic bristle dish brush and a nylon scrubbie. Very disappointed and probably won't use it any longer since we will worry about more teflon peeling off.

reviews.reviewTitle: LARGE, easy to use, easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve wanted one of these since I saw one on a Black Friday special and I missed out. This one is large enough for me to cook a side or a few filets for my family of five. This thing is ginormous. When I first opened it I was shocked by the size! But I am happy with the fact that it holds a lot. It‚Äôs easy to use and easy to clean. I do wish that the temp settings were by quarter incriminates so it‚Äôd be easier to see what it‚Äôs set to. It doesn‚Äôt come with many recipes but you can google literally anything you want, I also joined a fb group for ideas! üò¨

Amazing! I use it all the time and it such a time saver. Makes cooking so much fun too. So far I've cooked ribeye steak, chicken wings, broccoli, corn on the cob, asparagus, eggplant. Everything thing comes out perfect. I googled the majority of cooking instructions from other people who use air fryers and get great ideas

Great product, i had no complaints with the air fryer, was easy to use, easy to clean and the. Food tasted great i will say avoid air frying tender fish in it because they may break apart while trying to remove or turn over! Again great product

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and easy to use! Food tastes great without all the grease.
reviews.reviewText: I never wanted an air fryer....I like my food fried in lots of grease. One day I opened the Amazon app and saw this air fryer as a ‚Äòdeal of the day‚Äô. Was a great price so I bought it and it was delivered in a couple of days. What a great buy! Anything that can be fried can be cooked in this. I‚Äôm so happy that I got this.....

I love this air fryer! It‚Äôs huge! I can fit enough in it to feed my family of 4. Everything comes out crispy and hot. I‚Äôve made French fries, chicken strips, egg rolls, tater tots, etc. I love that there‚Äôs no greasy mess or hot oil to deal with AND I don‚Äôt have to use my oven when it‚Äôs so hit outside to make fries.

I really like the nonstick surface. The pieces are a bit bulky to wash but are easy to clean. I like using it for salmon because there is a less odor in the house than using other methods of cooking. It's also good for roasting a whole chicken and for roasting potatoes without adding a lot of oil.

reviews.reviewTitle: It sort of works but does not really make food crispy as my wife expected
reviews.reviewText: My wife has given up on cooking in this air fryer. After reading all the great reviews, she wanted to try one. She followed the instructions on using it but did not find the final food products to our daughter's or her liking. The basket is much smaller than she expected so she can't cook much food in it.

We've had this thing for almost 5 months. We loved having an air fryer (this was our first one), but this thing is very low quality for something that we spent $100 on. Within about a month, the non-stick coating inside started to flake off and peel. Now at less than 5 months, it has stopped working and simply will not heat up anymore. It still blows air, but it blows cold...

Here's hoping that a different air fryer will be better.

Wow. This Air fryer is simply amazing. When it arrived I was shocked to be honest. I guess I didn‚Äôt read the specs at all because it is huge! Now, with that being said, it‚Äôs perfect. It cooks evenly, the food is crisp and delicious. First thing I fried was chicken wings and they were as good as any Buffalo Wild Wings I promise... great investment!

We have really been enjoying this air fryer. We are still learning, but we have chicken down pretty good. Roasting and thighs. Delicious! It is also very easy to clean.
