I use it to make bacon, veggies, jalapeno poppers and my husband uses it for all of the fried goodies. It now has a permanent spot on my kitchen counter as I use it almost every day. Very user friendly, and easy to clean. Highly recommended!

I bought this product 3 weeks ago and the 3rd time that I used it, it cracked the my corian countertop. The countertop obviously gets very hot. There is nowhere in the manual where it warns about protecting the countertop. It does state to keep it 6 inches away from everything. I did some research and to no surprise, this has happened to other people. Hindsight is 20/20. Some sort of heat shield underneath it would work. Now here is the kicker, the customer service for this company is horrendous. The "boss" for customer service is 100% worthless. I beg everyone not to buy this product!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I purchased this in November from a T.V. shopping channel. It lasted as long as my flexible payments and the timer switch gave out rendering this machine useless. I read other reviews and I it seems like other people had this same problem. will never purchase another Dash product again.

Life changing.
Amazing.
Innovative.

Three words that would accurately describe my air fryer. My fiance and I ordered this on a whim (we are both foodies). I'm all about healthy living, but still want to eat well. This fryer combines both! So far we've tried wings could rival Wing Stop, fries that taste "fried", yummy chicken breast (restaurant worthy) potato poppers, steak, corn, sausage and bacon. The excitement on our faces as we check and "shake" our food reminds me of Christmas Eve. The cook time and cleanup are both short! If you are debating on whether or not to purchase, let me help you - SNAIL YEA! (Note: As far as size- go BIG- you'll thank me later!)
I used this for the first time today and I was pleasantly surprised that my chicken breast was very crispy on the outside and still juicy on the inside. I definitely recommend this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont use metal utensils when removing food.
reviews.reviewText: So far it's great for stuff that's been pre fried then frozen. Like chicken nuggets, french fries, fried fish sticks, and chicken wings.

I am so happy I purchased this product! It changes the texture of food to what it should be when heated, crispy! My son has some texture aversions and this has changed our food game, he will now eat chicken nuggets, veggies, and more...truly a game changer!
so far works like a dream.havent found anything wrong with it

Everything about it was awesome BUT after only 2 months of not so frequent use the bottom of fry basket has rust on it so we stopped using it.. Sent am email to the company about it but nobody answeredü§®üòè
Loved it- good size, easy controls. But the noisy fan failed. Dash replaced it under warranty. Quieter fan, only a hum. Cooks better, faster. Loving it again. Thanks Dash.
It uses a lot of electricity and takes longer to cook than the book says it will.
Great air fryer that exceeded my expectations. Very easy to use with absolutely no issues.
Product is great and self explanatory to use out of the box. Comes with a handful of recipes. Its big that might be the only drawback, but just means it can fit more food.
Works like a charm!
Worked very well
Nothing
Good

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size for family and friends. Works great and super easy to clean
reviews.reviewText:
¬†This Air fryer is awesome. I have a smaller version by the same company but wanted a larger one so I thought I would give this one a go. Love it. It‚Äôs the perfect size for having some friends or family over. Super easy to use and works fast.

USAGE: plug it, add what you want to cook, make sure you close the tray properly, rotate the temperature then rotate the time dial and it starts cooking. Cleaning is easy as the basket separates from the base bull out tray.

I did chicken wings, seasoned with just some BBQ dry rub spices and threw them cooked for 20 mins, rotated them and cooked for another 10 mins and they were awesome.

Only concern I have is where do I store this beast?!

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy! Fell apart in 3 months!
reviews.reviewText:
6/27/19 Updated review:
After using this for only 3 months, the temperature guide on top wore off (I used nail polish to guesstimate) , the safety on the handle broke and the screws came out! Now I have NO IDEA what temp I'm cooking at! IT'S JUNK!
This was our first air fryer purchase. The other thing that could be better are the dials. Often my fingers are slippery and the dial is not grooved so there is no grip whatsoever! They offered to replace it, but who has time to rebox and PAY FOR THE RETURN?! Not us!

We have two young kids and having the larger size air fryer is SO helpful. The fact that you can easily fit a roaster chicken in it is fantastic - this fryer cooks it perfectly - super crispy skin and tender, incredibly flavorful meat. And can make delicious veggie side dishes that more readily feed a family. Also love that the basket and drawer can go right in the dishwasher. Score!

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
When this Dash air fryer arrived I was taken aback by the size and wondered where people with small kitchens put it. Still, I was excited to have it. Dash is a brand I know because I have two of their Greek yogurt makers that are terrific.

I made chicken fingers first. They were overcooked and tasteless. Next, I made baked potatoes that were so terrible that I wondered why anyone would make baked potatoes in this instead of an oven or microwave. Next, I roasted an almost seven pound turkey breast. Dry and shrunken. All made using recipes I found online or in an air fryer cookbook. I thought it must be me who was doing something wrong. Air fried tofu was the next thing I made and was exceptionally careful. It came out okay--probably because cooking time is short and my vegetarian son said it was good. Pretty tasteless, I thought, but that's tofu for you. Then, I decided to make the Monkey Bread recipe in the booklet that came with the Dash Air Fryer.
It tells you to use two cans of refrigerator biscuits. No brand name or type given. I bought two cans--each with eight biscuits inside. One can turned out to just fit in the fryer. I very carefully followed the recipe exactly. What I ended up with were burnt sugar hockey pucks. See picture. Hard and inedible.

Very disappointing to get a defective air fryer. It is going back to Amazon tomorrow. I may eventually buy another one, but for now I will make do with my oven and microwave. I may be a slow learner, but at least I know it isn't me.

This is a huge airfryer. It can probably fit 4 chicken thighs, so it is perfect for a family of 3 -4. I was so excited to try it out and cooked some crispy fried pork belly. It turned out great! Could not even tell that it was cooked in an airfryer with very little oil spray. Can't wait to try this for other food that we usually fry like fish and sausages. A great appliance to have for a healthier lifestyle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everyone should have one of these!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: ¬†WOW!!!!! This is the best appliance I have ever bought!!!! I am so happy right now. NO MORE MESSY OILS!!!! My family eats fries with just about everything. Every time I go to use the fry daddy the oil is nasty and needs to be changed. With this air fryer I don‚Äôt need to worry about that ANY MORE!!!!!!! And it works great, the best part is the kids can use it and I don‚Äôt have to worry about the house setting on fire. It is so simple to use my dogs can do it!!!! This is a must have for every house hold in the world!!!!!! It is so much safer and don‚Äôt have to worry about where to Dispose of that nasty oil!!!!

I am not an "extreme diet" kind of person. I don't want to eat rabbit food for the rest of my life. This is a healthier way for me to fry foods. I can't tell the difference. This is a small change in my eating habits that could make a real difference. This weekend, I look forward to trying it on wings and onion rings for the Super Bowl.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smaller was fine but the Deluxe will be better!
reviews.reviewText: Like many other reviewers, I started with the Compact and loved it so much that I wanted to do more recipes with it and ended up getting the Deluxe. I have posted a comparison picture for you to see the difference. The inside of the larger basket will allow me to cook larger quantities and sizes of food. We will keep the Compact downstairs behind our bar to have easy access to snacks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great deep fryer, lots of storage
reviews.reviewText: You can put an entire chicken in here and it comes out moist. All the grease slides right off of it, a lot healthier than deep frying.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far...I am very pleased with the DASH Air Fryer!
reviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve used the fryer for frozen french fries and salmon. The fries were crispy and very hot. Better than oven baked. The salmon was excellent. 2 good size pieces cooked for 10 to 12 minutes at 400 degrees. Coated the fish with olive oil, salt, pepper and herbs. Added lemon slices (placed on each piece) to the basket. Very easy to clean fryer. It‚Äôs big. Have to find a place to store it. I wanted a bigger fryer. This one is perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coating on Dash Air Fryer basket and pan peeling
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
The coating in the the Dash air fryer basket and bottom pan started peeling after only a few weeks of use. One spot in the basket looked like a miss on making a hole (see photos).

When I contacted them for warranty service they said they were out of parts and that I would have to get on a waiting list for a part or I could return it where I got it.

This is all unfortunate since it worked great as an air fryer.

This is my first air fryer- as many have said prior- why did I wait so long??!!

As a newbie, some things that really came to light very quickly where- the temps and timer are vague. Its not a programmable, it's a timer turner'ish type of deal. With that said, I've not had any issues with the outcome. If you have a tendency to want exactness- this isn't a good fit. Go with the flow, your good.

Note: I have not found a graceful way to do pizzas or omelettes due to inexperience or inability to use a spatula. It's always a slide out or a lucky flip... I'm working on it.

What this does for salmon is worth every penny!! Have had fun with tenders and am searching for very healthy recipies which are available online easy.

This is a really big appliance but I'm glad I went with this size vs the smaller- I can see how the smaller would not really work for 3 people.

Make sure you have a place for the 'big egg' that does wonders for food. Potatoes are amaZing!
This air fryer is large enough for the whole family. It's easy to use, and love that it doesn't use oil.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Deal of Day, Easy, Fast -- Why did I wait so long
reviews.reviewText: I've had this less than a week and so far this has been a great edition to cooking tools as it's the only thing I've used to cook for past 3 days (steak, roasted chickapeas, hamburgers, crescent roll hotdogs, and apple crisp). Clean up was super easy. The hamburgers did cause a bit of smoke in the house. The only downside to me is the dials, it's almost like give or take a minute or 2 on the timer dial as getting it exact would be too much a task. The temperature dial has most used marked or you can figure but if you get an odd like 390 setting, then I'm gonna be close but have no idea if exact. The size is great, glad I went with a 6qt instead of starting off with a smaller size.

I really wanted an air fryer, but I also wanted something that looked nice since I‚Äôd have to place it on my kitchen counter. So when I saw that Dash made this stylish air fryer, that was a pretty decent size, I had to buy it. However, I just couldn‚Äôt get past the smell. Fair warning, I have a keen sense of smell. And so when I first opened the air fryer all I smelled was plastic. But after washing it a few times, the smell was fair and it was okay. I decided to try making tortilla chips. They came out awful. They were soggy, not fried at all, but worst of all... I could taste the plastic smell. Next I tried French fries. Same thing... the fryer would not fry and that ‚Äòplastic taste‚Äô made my food inedible. My husband also tasted the plastic. So we thought maybe something was melting inside. After a quick inspection, and finding nothing was melting, we just figured that‚Äôs what the food would taste like.

We followed all the directions, hand washed everything that was washable and still that plastic smell would not go away. And I tried frying a few more things but again they wouldn‚Äôt fully fry. At one point everything was spinning around in the basket and it made a mess.

This totally bummed me out that it didn‚Äôt work properly. Needless to say we returned the product. But now I‚Äôm a bit scared to purchase another air fryer. I think I‚Äôll stick to lightly frying my food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Air Frying - Where Has This Been My Whole Life??
reviews.reviewText:
I have discovered a whole new world of cooking! Not only are there all kinds of cool meals you can make in this thing, you can also make all the hum-drum frozen things in this air fryer FASTER than you did in the oven. So far, I have really just made wings and cooked frozen things from the freezer, but I am blown away. The wings were amazing and the frozen things were all way better than they are when they come out of the oven. They are crispier and get done a lot quicker.
As for the device itself, this thing is a beast! Granted I did not read the dimensions of the appliance, but I was quite shocked at how big it is. That being said, it does not look unattractive on the counter. I purchased the black one and it is a very large egg shape. The basket is easy to release and everything cleans up easily. The things I have made so far, though, really haven't made much of a mess.
One note - pay attention to the sticker on the front that says not to press the release button without having a support under the basket. My dumb butt, in my excitement to unpack the device, was like I wonder what this does?. Slide off the cover, push the button and out dropped the basket. Fortunately I caught it on the first bounce after glancing off the counter and there was just a slight ding in the bottom. I looked over after that and saw the sticker warning me to not do the dumb thing I just did. lol. Anyway, be careful releasing the basket because the metal is not super thick and I imagine a good drop to the ground would ding it up pretty good.
So bottom line - this air fryer is awesome. It's my first one, so I don't have much to compare it to, but I can definitely say that I like it. Of all the appliances I have bought for the kitchen, this one goes right up there with the egg cooker. They both seem gimmicky, but both are awesome and well worth owning!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked exceptionally for two months, then fan simply QUIT.
reviews.reviewText: This fryer was bought to replace one that had the drawer accidentally melted on the stove top when someone turned on the wrong burner. We had really liked that one-- but immediately fell in LOVE with THIS one, once we finally started using it! It took less time to heat up, drawer closed super tight so ran cool outside the fryer, and cooked crispier in much less time. Even cleaned easier! We were extremely pleased with it... Then... poof. Pre heating to make dinner, we realized although the heat was on, the fan was not working... Nothing we did made any difference, unplugging and restarting it, etc... We tried it all. Machine had not been dropped, gotten wet, no reason for the issue. Of course, The time frame for getting any product help through Amazon is 2 weeks and two days too late-- FUDGE. Murphy's Law!

I don't know what I like best., that frozen fried food comes out as though you freshly deep fried it somehow, or that I can keep reheating and re-crisping my french fries, or that I can eat as much deep fried food as I want without having to use, clean, filter and dispose of massive amounts of deep fryer oil, which to be healthy, gets expensive, or that my fried food is done in half the time it usually takes to preheat the dinosaur oven. I even made toast in it. There's really nothing to clean up after. I've used it half almost a dozen times now, and the most I've had to do is wipe the basket inside with a paper towel. This thing is a game changer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick & Easy Dash Electric Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: I was very skeptical that food would cook, be crispy, and taste good all in a matter of minutes. Well, it's really true. We saw a TV news segment about how popular these fryers have become, so we wanted to give it a try for ourselves. Our first project was to make sweet potato fries with a great big sweet potato. We didn't want to wait 30 minutes to soak the cut potatoes, so we put them in a bowl and used olive oil spray to lightly coat them. We tossed them in the basket and turned it on. Only 14 minutes later (after shaking the basket (horizontally) after the first 7 minutes, we had perfect crispy fries. Wow! That was impressive. The machine stops when you open the basket to check the status of the food, so there's no worry of becoming crispy yourself by opening the basket. It's hard to believe that it works so well and so easily, so I know it will get a lot of use. What fun to rediscover enjoying foods we avoided because of all the fat. I highly recommend this unit. It does have a big footprint, so be sure to check out the measurements so you know you'll have a place to store it when not in use. It isn't extremely heavy, so it can be moved around.

reviews.reviewTitle: Originally Gave 5 stars, now I am not sure.
reviews.reviewText:
I am not one to run out and get the newest kitchen novelty on the market. This caught my attention just for the fact that it is quick and doesn't heat up the kitchen. My husband will love french fries with those BBQ Burgers in the summer. I always hate to turn on my 36" Wolf oven in the summer. This was a great answer to the problem. Makes rubbed chicken breast delicious. I could go on, baked potatoes, broccoli, meatball, sausage, whole chickens, bbq ribs, etc, all so GREAT!!
UPDATE: 5/16/19, 2 Months later inside bottom of basket has bubbled and finish has peeled off. I only soak with water and dawn and use microfiber cleaning cloth. Why did this happen?
UPDATE: 7/28/19, 4 Months Now and I need a new basket. I can't find a "replacement" Basket anywhere. I am willing to purchase a replacement basket, but what the heck, there is none out there. I still love my fryer, now using paper discs so not to contaminate my food with Teflon or whatever peels off the bottom. NOT HAPPY!

UPDATE: Oct 3, 2019: Still a fiver for us as function for cost is great
however, after some 'clumsy' moves on my part I managed to separate the plastic housing from the drawer
see images
I'll fix with automotive high temp glue which I believe will perform.
It's a fail point.

BUT LOVE the quality and QUICK and EASY manner this product works- still buying another.
------------

Bought the green one and it's AWESOME... we've had for years, I mean over two decades the Graham Kerr Galloping Gourmet version which worked great
but
it went toasty finally.
This like our older version is EASY to use, two dials, easy clean
Galloping Gourmet had a covered coil piece - this one doesn't, GG had a Clean Mode, this one doesn't, GG had a air-speed function again this one doesn't: GG had larger interior but bigger foot print
BUT WORKS EXCELLENTLY

we put two pork chops and a half rack of port ribs [maxed out] couple small potatoes at 250F for max 30 min time and PERFECT juicy and ready to eat

this is a nice meal maker.

Take out the drawer, breaks down to easy sink cleaning: We do NOT use the dishwasher.....really? that's just not needed. Soap, wash brush and all is done.

Want two. Why? the amount of food for say two is ok, but company...well, can easily cook for four and ready at the same time.

No words can describe just how much I love this air fryer. It was a huge impulse by thanks to a lightning deal and I have zero regrets. I didn‚Äôt even look at its size when I ordered but with a family of 4, I‚Äôm so grateful it‚Äôs so damn big!

I love Dash products and have little baby waffle iron that I use for a small batch of eggs (trust me on this) and making a waffle using a canned cinnamon roll. I‚Äôve only had the air fryer a little over a week and have already used it for many meals, snacks and reheating.

I‚Äôve made: Pork loin chops, chicken, bacon wrapped asparagus, honey BBQ wings, broccoli, steak fries, mozzarella sticks, canned cinnamon rolls, corndogs, tater tots and much more to come.

With the help of a website, I have easily figured out the conversion times of anything in the oven to the air fryer and I LOVE it. It‚Äôs easy for my kids to use as well. There are accessory bundles available so it‚Äôs easier to make things without fear of it dripping to the under pan, which does wipe out super easy but I‚Äôve placed paper towels at the bottom. I‚Äôve heard that you can do cakes in the air fryer so I‚Äôm going to try it. Remember that anything you can put in the oven, can go in the air fryer, it is just a matter of time conversion to cooking it thoroughly. Also, use a bit of oil, it‚Äôs ok. AND do not believe every Facebook or Pinterest post. It may take time to figure everything out and get it right. My cinnamon rolls from the can work great the first time but you HAVE to flip them halfway through or just one side gets cooked. I didn‚Äôt mind doing this. I also recommend the parchment papers, 100 for $9, makes cleanup easy and no weird cutting to get it the right size.

I recommend this air fryer and I‚Äôd have gladly paid full price instead of the lightning deal price. I‚Äôve at one point seen it for $109, glad to see it for only $99 right now.

I love this Air Fryer! I was skeptical at first but one batch of chicken wings made me a believer. haha. This is a large capacity air fryer but the food is better cooked in one layer so keep that in mind. Also be aware this fryer will take up a LOT of room on your kitchen counter or wherever you store it so bear that in mind if your kitchen is small like mine. For best results: preheat the fryer about 5 minutes for bone-in meat, which I seem to have the best results with. Still experimenting with it at this point but have done boneless chicken tenders, wings, drummettes and bone-in pork chops. Also tried fried (battered frozen) okra --it turned out dry. Fresh veggies turn out best in it as anything frozen has to thaw first then cook. I have used only minimal olive oil or olive oil non stick spray and love that the food isn't greasy but taste just like it was fried the "regular" way. The color is beautiful as well. I am using this fryer for a family of 4 and wanted a large capacity. Even though it takes up a lot of room I'm glad I got the larger one as it cooks more food at a time than a smaller one and the less time I am cooking the better. I recommend this fryer.

I purchased the Air Fryer when it was $30 cheaper that list price. It arrived in perfect shape.
It was easy to use in that there are only 2 dials - one a temperature control and one a temperature dial.
It cooked frozen fries very easily; Cooking fresh potatoes was just "OK".
Cooking Frozen Wings were better than baking but inferior to frying.
Cooking Chicken Breasts that were breaded to fry came out juicy but didn't look very appetizing.
Will this product save you time? Of Course.
Was it easy to use? Of Course
Was it worth the money? That depends - Do you like carbs/fried foods and don't care about your health? Then this is fine.
Although Air Frying is better for you than frying, although or the Air Fryer, i just kept asking "Why am I eating carbs". I haven't purchased as many potatoes or eaten as many potatoes (Traditional & Sweet) that I have using this. Sorry, but I'd rather avoid eating potatoes except for holidays - fried/baked/air fried just not worth it. Same for the other things that this can cook
Yes, you can make meals in this item, but it takes more work than other kitchen equipment like your toaster oven (Breville) or InstaPot.

I opened up my dash air fryer excited to cook the chicken I had marinated for dinner. After I plugged it in and turned it on I went and fed the dog. 20 minutes later I went to check on the chicken and discovered that my dinner was still cold. The fan was turning, the light was on the power and temperature knobs, but the heating element did not heat up. I got a dead air fryer. What a total disappointment. What am i gonna do now?

reviews.reviewTitle: Timer shut it off, EDIT bumped to 5 Stars.
reviews.reviewText:
Edit: I figured it out. Just set the timer beyond the cook time. Now I set it for 30 minutes plus and check it now and then. Works great now. 5 stars.
I‚Äôm cooking chicken, set timer for 10 minutes, ding, shake basket, reset timer, insert basket...no power.
Try it again. insert basket with timer on, 400 degrees, nothing. Won‚Äôt restart.
It will not restart no matter what...unplug, plug back in, reset basket, no lights, no heat. Meanwhile, chicken just sits getting impatient.
Maybe 10 minutes later, it will begin restart to heat again. Dried chicken by now from just sitting. Now, set the timer for longer. Open it up, shake...same thing, reinsert basket...won‚Äôt restart. My chicken is getting bored. I‚Äôm annoyed. And hungry.
Seems it has an override to prevent overheating. I just can‚Äôt make it start again to continue cooking after taking out the basket or if the timer goes off. I have to wait at least 10 minutes to continue cooking. Meanwhile, my chicken is now jerky, I ate everything else, not hungry anymore for dried chicken.

This is my first air fryer, so I have no comparison. So far, I'm impressed. Easy to use, easy to clean. My 14 y/o daughter cooked chicken nuggets first & they came out great. She also tried fried okra, and that didn't work because she didn't break apart the frozen okra ball (I tried to tell her, but... teenagers). I cooked chicken fingers, onion rings, & hush puppies all together just to see what this thing would do. Chicken & hush puppies were perfect, onion rings were overdone (operator error, I should have added them half way through cooking the other things maybe?).
So far, it's great. It's a mini convection oven. Cooking is fast & even. I like that there aren't a lot of dials & options. I mean, pretty much everything can be cooked at 350ish degrees, right? That being said, the top knob does adjust temp. I just figure my kids will toss food in and turn the timer. I'm excited to cook a chicken & not heat up the kitchen with the big oven (I live in the South, you don't heat up the house in the summer).
Two thumbs up, so far!

I ordered this on 1 day and received it less than 2 days later! I've used it twice so far. No big thrills with buttons on it but has the timer and temperature. Very easy to use and super easy to clean. I've made asparagus and butternut squash in it so far. I know my family actually wants a "fried" type of food but this is what I do! So far, I love it!

Use caution with this product. I have had this air fryer for about 3 months and found it's not holding up. The bottom drip pan and the basket will separate but sometimes separate when you dont want them to. It suggests when cooking French fries to shake every 5 min but when you shake the basket it separates from the drip pan and WILL LAND DIRECTLY ON YOUR TOE!!!

If you are scrolling reviews to see if you should buy, stop here and click buy now! This thing is AMAZING! I used it twice the first day, couldn't get enough of it! It has a large capacity and cleans very easily. I am already so fasinated with this machine! Just buy one already, you will love it too!!

I was a bit reluctant to buy an air fryer, having never had one before, but this was a deal of the day and the price was right, so I went for it. I (along with my husband) am so glad I did! This machine is super simple to use. Just set the time and temperature and off you go! It heats up quickly, cooks food evenly, and is a breeze to clean up since the parts that need to be washed can go right in the dishwasher. We've made several things so far (it's only been a week) but our favorite by far is chicken wings--faster, quicker, healthier, and, most importantly, tastier, than ordering out. We are very happy with our purchase!

Mine came damaged. I‚Äôm a bit upset that it didn‚Äôt work. The fan was stuck and it wouldn‚Äôt work properly. Plus the top would overheat because the fan didn‚Äôt work . I sent it back in but bought something entirely different . I previously called the actual company and told them what was happening they offered to replace it but they said they were on back order for weeks so to contact Amazon and have it returned....so at least they were willing to replace it. Plus it was huge like a giant egg actually a bit of an eyesore so I‚Äôm glad I didn‚Äôt decide to buy the same one again after seeing it on my counter it was a bit overwhelming how big it was to have such a small basket for cooking.

Bought when on sale through Amazon. Great product! Easy to make foods with a fried type coating. Cooks quickly and evenly, not exactly like typical fried food but pretty close without the greasiness. Made fried chicken and fish quite a bit...always turns out great, not tough or rubbery either. Suggest to get an oil mister to spray the insert and food prior to cooking, makes it really easy to get crisp coating. Can fit a few wings and thighs in maybe 5 pieces total for each cook cycle. Using the accessories available on Amazon, such as a rack increases the amount you can cook for one cycle. Cleanup is a breeze and takes minimal time to figure out temp dial and times for cooking. Can also check web on recipes and cook time suggestions. Highly recommend this air fryer for cooking space, ease of use and results.

reviews.reviewTitle: hard to clean, fills house with smoke cooking bacon
reviews.reviewText: works fine with most foods like potatoes (fries, hashbrowns, tater tots) and other foods as long as you check and rotate the outside with the inside during cooking. If you don't the ones on the outside will burn prior to the inside circle getting done. wouldn't use to cook bacon or any heavily greasy foods unless outside...this thing is like a smoke stack pumping out white smoke about 5-7 minutes into cooking bacon. best thing I found is to put a little water in the bottom before cooking bacon and running at 400 degrees for 6 minutes and rotate outside to inside and flip bacon then hit with 325 degrees for another 5 minutes. overall works fine and does seem to make foods healthier. another con is that it is difficult to clean the basket in dishwasher and usually hand wash to make sure bits don't get left behind and taint the next food you cook.

The unit is well built and very easy to use. The controls are intuitive, and placed well on the unit. The flavor is good and it produces a crispiness that is very enjoyable.

My only downside to this unit is that the bottom basket is black in color, and the black paint is chipping off during cleaning. We use a plastic sponge, never a knife or anything sharp, and I would think the paint would not peel off. That is disappointing. If it wasn't for this issue, I would have given the product all 5's across the board.

It's a pretty nifty product! Would it replace frying in oil or a toaster oven? Maybe. It doesn't heat up the house like an oven or toaster oven would, which is nice, but I get about the same results from our toaster oven.
The only issue I have is the timer can't be turned backwards, so it has to tick-tock until it's done. You can turn the temp to off while it's doing its tick-tock, though.
So far we've made fried pickles, chicken fingers, cinnamon rolls, pierogis, and croissants. I love it for little baking things.

Look, i dont usually get on here and have to many serious posts, but i've got to get something off my chest.

Background: I bought my wife this air fryer for her birthday (which is 3 months away), and due to the way it was packaged when ups dropped it off, she got it early. (Because it was in the Air fryer box when ups dropped it off!!!!) I should have opted for the gift option, but i thought i would be home in time to get it, before her. Didnt work out.

Now for the serious part of the story...... if anyone is debating on getting this air fryer, worry no more. I am here to give you my full review.....

We have had this air fryer for approx. 2 weeks. In that time, this air fryer has perfectly cooked everything we've put in it.
Whether it is french fries, doughnuts, or "chick-fil-a" style chicken, each item my wife has cooked in the air fryer. Has been perfectly cooked!

I say all that to bring you up to speed with tonights menu....... CHICKEN WINGS!!!!!!! My wife made a brown sugar/bourbon sauce and a parmesan garlic sauce to toss the wings in. FIRST, the wings were perfectly cooked, crispy, and juicy on the inside. Then, she tossed them in some sauces she "just whipped together".

I want to announce to all of amazon that 4 chicken wings into our dinner, i renewed my vows with my wife. I'm not sure if it was the air fryers ability to perfectly cook the wings, the sauces she "whipped together", or a combo of the two, but everyone needs to get one!!!! (An air fryer, not my wife. SHE'S MINE)!!!!!!!

To summarize, if your wondering if you should buy this air fryer, the answer is YES!!!!

SIDENOTE: it may save some of your marriages. Thank me later.

I don't normally cook, my idea of a typical dinner is something frozen from Trader Joe's. It's all the food prep, and clean up that turns me off. My sister told me about the air fryer and well why not. Best gaget in my kitchen!!! I cook fresh meals 3-4 days a week from easy recipes I find on Pinterest. I only use a light dusting of olive oil on the bottom of the basket and I don't even think I need that. My food is crisp and cooked wonderfully. Nothing I cook has taken more than 14 minutes. I talk to everyone I know about my new air fryer and am so glad I got it. Now it is a large appliance on your counter top, but I just take it out for a few days at a time then put it back in the box and away it goes. The best part is that it's EASY to clean!!!

Have used this at least once (sometimes more) every day since it was received a week ago. It has earned a permanent place on my counter. I have also used some ceramic dishes in it (using a folded piece of aluminum foil as a sling for easy removal and to protect the non-stick baked coating from the unfinished ceramic base) and it's great for reheating.

So far I've made breaded calimari, broccoli and squash, London broil, panco-breaded drumsticks, sausages and hash browns, tater tots, pizza rolls and fish sticks. It has pretty much replace the toaster oven completely and I've hardly used the microwave.

Highly recommended if you have the room for it because it is big.

reviews.reviewTitle: Meh, think twice if you have a convection oven
reviews.reviewText: This "air fryer" is the first experience I've had with them. It's pretty easy to use and the food comes out as if you had cooked it in a convection oven, not fried. Nothing is going to replace oil fried food. If you dipped the food in oil before you cooked it, it might come closer. But isn't that defeating the purpose? Now for the bad...the thing is huge, it's loud and it blows super hot air into your kitchen out of the back of the unit. Any one of those things alone had I known before purchasing would have deterred me. If you have a ton of room in your kitchen and don't have a convection oven setting you may want to give this a try, otherwise I'd pass.

We never expected it to be as good and easy as it was. Our first time using it we made chicken wings. Put some Old Bay Seasoning, garlic powder and pepper. We had 30 pieces, half drum and half flat, so we did it in two batches and took a little under and hour. There were so delicious, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. We were both very surprised that they were as delicious and looked as good as the wings on the youtube videos we watched. The two baskets are dishwasher safe but I chose to hand wash them which was very easy with some Dawn, warm water and a sponge. Nothing stuck to it! Very happy!

I was skeptical over this thing, but a family member brought one over and we were impressed enough to try it out. We've done all sorts of chicken (wings, nuggets, tenders), shrimp, lumpia, egg rolls, french fries, mozzarella sticks, pork chops, and my wife even tried a grilled cheese at the request of my kid. It's all turned out great. Quick frozen items we would normally throw in the microwave we now throw in this and it's way better. Takes very little oil if any at all to get a crispiness on your food. Cleaning is very, very easy - sometimes what looks stuck on sprays right off.

reviews.reviewTitle: See photos. Overall a decent air fryer.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this a few months ago and loved it at first. Would have given 5 star, but after only a couple months of use the basket and bottom started to peel off. I did not use anything abrasive to clean this with. I still continued to use it with liners because still love the taste of the food made in it. Therefore why keeping it at 4 star for the most part. Second one I ordered they put instructions sticker right on front. Tried to peel off and now can't get the sticky yuck looking stuff off. Wanted clean and pretty looking like in the photos online. Disappointed about that. Won't keep me from using it though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I wait so long!
reviews.reviewText: We researched dozens of air fryers and went back and forth with making a decision. There were a couple we decided on but when we read the reviews, did not purchase. Finally, we cautiously purchased this one since reviews seemed pretty good. We use it EVERY DAY! We have cooked everything from steak to veggies in it without having to add all the extra oils and butter with pan-fry or grilling. I am also glad we purchased the larger volume so we can cook enough for a family. It is easy to use and makes cooking really fast. I highly recommend this AF and would buy it again!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast cooking, easy to clean, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I've had this air fryer for a little over a week and have used it almost every day. I can't speak to the durability over time but so far it seems really well made and crazy easy to clean. I've made the basics (tater tots and waffle fries), nachos, hashbrowns, bacon wrapped lil smokies, asparagus and little potatoes. I think the air fried veggies are my favorite so far - its so nice to roast vegetables quickly & without waiting for the oven to heat up and not having to clean a huge sheet pan afterwards. This brand has the best price for the size. I say get it, you won't be disappointed.

Edited after one month of use:
The coating on the basket is peeling off after using no more than 8 times in a month. I purchased this and it was delivered while i was moving, so it sat in the box until the return window was up, unfortunately. I can still use it but don‚Äôt really want this black coating peeling off and sticking to my food. Bummer.

Original review, one week earlier:
I love this for broccoli, quicker than oven roasting. haven't managed to make good sweet potato fries from scratch yet.... seems to dehydrate them more than "fry" them. But worth the price for the broccoli alone!

I LOVE IT!!! I have the Dash Rapid Egg Cooker, so when I found out Dash had an air fryer, I checked it out on YouTube and bought me the deluxe model. I have yet to use it as an actual Air Fryer....lol. I been cooking chicken thighs almost every day. I don‚Äôt cook with salt so I use a lot of powdered seasonings (garlic, cumin, allspice, garam masala, etc...) and olive oil and put it into the fryer for 18 minutes at 350. I love that there are only 2 dials. Temperature and time. Clean up is easy. It‚Äôs a non-stick coating. Cooked salmon fillets which came out great. I think 8 minutes at 400. I use mostly everyday since buying it. I‚Äôm not into cooking, so anything that makes it easier is great by me!!! Bought mines at the end of May.

In our retired years, I do the cooking for my wife and me. I don't do baking of cakes et; al. I use this air fryer every day sometimes twice a day. There are air fryer recipes on the Internet. I love air frying! Out deep fryer met the trash been after a few weeks of using the air fryer. It says dishwasher safe and it is. However, my state of the art dishwasher does not get it clean. I clean it with a soft brush. The cleaning is easy if you allow the basket and basket container to soak in soapy water for a few minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I brought this in March its now April. My return window closed on the 12th and wouldn't you know it the handle to the basket keeps falling out of the bucket when you lift it out. Not only that but any little bit of moisture seems to be seeping through a screw hole on the bottom which makes it burn and smoke up the kitchen. I am really disappointed.

When the reviews said it was large,,,yep! I am lucky to have a cabinet top to have it. This is the only negative comment I have. The food is tasty, crispy, & so yummy. It‚Äôs too darn easy to whip up a snack of French fries and so easy to clean up. Bacon, heavenly & am now working on a way to ‚Äòfry‚Äô eggs. Appetite & imagination is your only boundary. Oh, just remember to pre-heat. Will put on my ‚Äòto buy for gift‚Äô list. Moving on to poultry & meats. I may start to look as round as the fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: We haven‚Äôt used our oven or microwave in months!
reviews.reviewText: The oven takes to long to heat the microwave makes stuff soggy or not evenly heated the air fryer is great! Makes leftovers taste like freshly cooked food and makes cooking food quick and easy! We even took this on vacation with us to the beach house we rented recently! It took ma a little trial and error for a few times but I managed to get a good idea on cook times. Also super simple to clean! Pull the basket clean it and the tray inside and put it back together maybe 5 minutes.

I am in love with this air fryer! The fan isn‚Äôt too loud. It cooks foods beautifully. It‚Äôs extremely easy to use and clean. After a few uses, I‚Äôve found that the basket is a little damaged (scratched/stained) . However, it is still working perfectly. It‚Äôs huge and sadly doesn‚Äôt fit in a ton of food but I‚Äôm definitely glad I bought it.

This is super easy! My daughter (9) can make hot dogs or nuggets, and is able to dump the basket when they‚Äôre done (I have her wait a few minutes so it‚Äôs not too hot). My husband learned it quickly, and operation is simple and functional!

My only complaint is that you have to set the timer precisely - you can‚Äôt dial it back if you go too far!

FYI: this is not the same color as the keurig, so if you‚Äôre trying to coordinate, it‚Äôs a fail!

I didn't know what to expect, I just bought the largest capacity air fryer that had more 5 star reviews. This did not disappoint at all. It takes minutes to cook salmon, catfish, and chicken. I can cook 7 chicken tenders at one time. For a family of 5 this is one of the best small appliance purchases I have made. I will say it does best if you preheat it for 5 minutes and cook in a single layer.

Cleaning is pretty easy. Food tastes great.

Cons: being short it‚Äôs hard to read the temperature dial on top. Timer dial is hard to turn if reducing time. I use next to my stove so I can use exhaust fan. If food is fatty like burgers, grease draining in bottom can cause smoke. Using exhaust fan has helped that.

Great for cooking so many things. Much more convenient than heating up oven.

Bought in a lightning deal for 70 so I think that was a good price.
This was alot larger than I expected, but it works wonderfully. Great quality

Makes great food once you figure out how long to cook something. Be very careful "shaking" the basket. I would usually rotate the items about halfway through the cooking process and with pizza rolls, I'd flip the contents to avoid flipping each piece individually and now each time I do, the inner and outer baskets separate. This typically leads to the outer basket landing on the floor or my foot. Ouch. And its hot, double ouch.

I did not expect that our friends were telling the truth aboutthis air fryer. We ordered and tried wings right away. Unbelievably, the BEST wings we have ever eaten. No oil used; we just used dry seasoning. They came out very crispy but a moist, tender inside underneath the crispy skin. We did the same with potatoes - delicious!. It is so much easier than using the oven and a cinch to clean. We are sold on it and have started giving them away as gifts. No complaints from anyone so far.

I got this on a lightning special too good to pass up. It‚Äôs quite nicely spacious inside. I love the retro look and color. I have only used it slightly but I think when I use it more I‚Äôll be good at gauging times. Still, nothing came out terribly wrong. The inside is DW-friendly and came out clean. It‚Äôs not digital but the dial is very straightforward. It does take up quite a bit of counter space but the color makes up for it in my case.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nut that holds fan fell off on to food.
reviews.reviewText: Nut that secures the fan fell off after 6 months. The nut and washer fell on to a burger that I was cooking, so I saw it. Clearly a serious problem, because it could result in injury if not seen before chewing food and possibly breaking a tooth or worse. I reattached the nut and washer, but am now concerned that it will need frequent checking to make sure it is secure. Dash should have used a locking nut and washer to prevent it from coming loose.
Cooks the food quick and easy to clean. My 10 year old daughter loves using it to cook French fries win win for me I would highly recommend this product

reviews.reviewTitle: We Waited a While to Review
reviews.reviewText: I am keto and ordered this to use for preparing many foods I can eat. My husband and I love this machine. My only complaint is that it is still pretty small compared to my deep fryer's basket and it takes three times in this one to do wings for us. It's great for many uses from steaks to wings. I love the size most times and I'm glad we did not go with a smaller one. I highly recommend this air fryer.

So far I'm not real impressed. I found recipes online for apple chips and banana chips. Both came out soggy. I used the directions in the book that came with the unit to make 1 chicken breast. Book says 10-15 minutes. I went with 15. Cut it in half, still raw in the middle. Put it back in for 10 more minutes. It was good, nice a juicy, but the directions shouldn't be that far off. I will keep trying but I'm not very hopeful. And it's bigger than I thought it would be. Storing it will be tricky.

I had been thinking about purchasing an air fryer for awhile. When this showed up on sale, I decided to go for it and so glad I did. I've used it every night since it arrived with great success. I'm loving it and the fact that you can put the basket in the dishwasher is even better.

I was hesistant to buy one of these because so many people I asked said they don't use theirs often. I use mine everyday. I try to cook different things in it often and its always worked fine...much easier than using the oven or pans on the stove. If necessary I will line with foil sometimes. This thing is amazing. Best thing Ive made is mozzarella sticks for the kids and chicken tenders but ive done it all!

reviews.reviewTitle: this product is hazardous to your health!!!
reviews.reviewText: After a month of use the black paint in the cooking areas is peeling off!!! Seriously??? Does anyone at amazon even do product testing and reviews before selling crap from China?? This is so disappointing because it‚Äôs such a basic thing to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Paint flakes off the inner cooking basket.
reviews.reviewText: I have had this item for 6-7 months, the device works well but two days ago we were re-heating chicken wings and noticed 3 places where the paint on the bottom of the basket had flaked off. We do not use any metal device to remove the food in the basket, we just dump the items into a bowl. Be very cautious cooking in this brand air fryer.

I love this air fryer. It cooks food quickly and easily. It does a wonderful job of crisping up frozen shrimp, egg rolls, french fries... anything that you would put in a regular fryer. It's also very easy to clean!
Fried great until it stopped working out of nowhere. Very disappointing product.

reviews.reviewTitle: You can‚Äôt believe you didn‚Äôt buy it sooner. üíïüíïüíï
reviews.reviewText: I was completely on the fence about ordering this fryer. I decided to give it a shot. Best purchase ever! I hate the odor fried food has this does not. I am very excited to say that everything thus far has come out awesome. Especially wings. I use NO oil at all. Fries, wings, potstickers, roasted potatoes the list is endless. I would stick to this size. Perfection.
This was a gift for our son and his family!!! They loved it!!! Our kids loved this one so much that my wife and I ordered the same one but in the smaller size.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks cool, not so hot performance
reviews.reviewText: During the first use, we noticed a section of plastic peeling from its foundation. And you still have to shuffle the fries around so they cook evenly.

This has been a wonderful addition to our kitchen. Fast and healthier options for those on the run, or for anyone who just wants to eat good food, done right. Comes out hot and juicy. Nothing has been dry or uneatable! We love it. Don't hesitate to purchase this. It is large enough for a family and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: You can‚Äôt adjust the timer forwards once it set, needs more settings
reviews.reviewText: I am giving this 4 stars just because it needs more temp. Settings and once you set the timer you can‚Äôt adjust it forward, once you pull the pan out to check your food the timer still goes and the heat stops. Wish it had more settings üòí but it‚Äôs nice and big and cooks good it‚Äôs just taking awhile to figure out what temp and for how long to cook things in it, even following the recipes isn‚Äôt 100% right.
I call it my spaceship because it‚Äôs big. However the one I currently have is 1.2 qt and small. I put this at the lake house which will be perfect for making appetizers for parties.

reviews.reviewTitle: Where has this been all my life?
reviews.reviewText: A thousand times yes to this product! Love it! My only regret is that we didn't buy this air fryer sooner. The basket is very roomy, easy to use & to clean. My family literally uses this every day. Foods come out with that great crispy crunch without being saturated in oil. I highly recommend this air fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Haven't gotten a good meal yet.
reviews.reviewText: Everything I've cooked has been overcooked. I attribute this to very few recipes in the enclosed booklet. A cooking chart would have been helpful. I'm going to keep trying to figure it out. If I have too many more failures, I'll probably just throw it away.
I love this thing. I use it almost every day now and it makes such good crisp food I don't know why I didn't have one sooner
I was really skeptical about this but it really works just like our deep fryer. Foods come out like crunchy perfection without using oil? Great purchase!

My FAVORITE kitchen appliance!!! I can healthily crisp any food in this and not feel the effects of a ton of grease! My family uses this fryer multiple times daily without any issues. Iys also very easy to operate and clean!!! I highly recommend this air fryer!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: takes to long and food was still raw
reviews.reviewText: i though it was good at first but tried to cook a chicken and the meat was still raw and i cooked it for 3 hours but if you cooking fries of a side dish its great but i sent it back because it didn't work like it said in the time it said

As a working mom with two kids, I am always looking for ways to expedite the cooking process. This air fryer has lived up to the expectations! I also purchased the accompanying cookbook and have enjoyed making new dinner recipes. This machine does take up a big portion of counter space, but I am willing to give that up when I can cook 5 chicken breasts.

reviews.reviewTitle: That you can cook without fat.
reviews.reviewText: Don't know how to everyday meals with it. I would like more instructions.

Love this product. It fits in the dishwasher and cooks quickly! The flavor is great, I do think it‚Äôs easier to use a spoon to shake things verse actually ‚Äúshaking‚Äù the basket. I‚Äôve made a bunch of things but love the wings and homemade chicken nuggets and fries!

I love this Air fryer. It is so big and spacious. I can fit enough things to cook at the same time. It also works well with chicken. It is easy to use just select your temperature and time. The basket comes off for easy cleaning.

This is beautiful & works better than I expected. It‚Äôs a little bigger than I hoped for & I do turn the heat a little higher & cook a little longer than the instructions say, but the food comes out very good & like it had been fried.

This is the best thing since sliced bread!! Easy to use, fast, food is delicious. I can‚Äôt wait to see what all I can cook with it. Onion rings, fries, chicken tenders, tater tots, reheat pizza, perfection! I‚Äôve only had it two weeks so far but more at a later date.

Love it! Makes great fries from the frozen purchased fries. Not soggy, crisp - and fast! I have never liked reheated fried chicken but it tastes almost freshly fried when reheated in the Dash. Great for breads., reheating pizza, reheating anything!

reviews.reviewTitle: Its been about 3 months of regular use, everything good!

reviews.reviewTitle: Speedy healthy best addition to my life for the kitchen..
reviews.reviewText: The color is so adorable and this kitchen gadget is life changing for busy healthy families. I have told so many people how much I love my air fryer! Easy to clean and can cook so many things in no time flat

I read so many great reviews and I was so excited to buy this and try it out. However, when I did, I wasn't that impressed with it. My oven does the same thing for just a little longer process and saves me counter space. I ended up returning it.
I love this thing!!! I have made chicken, French fries, Brussels sprouts and even corn. Everything cooked great. Easy to clean and easy to use!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great!!! Received it in just a couple days
reviews.reviewText: Love this air fryer it's big and makes everything so much faster than my smaller one. Got the Robin egg blue color and love it too!!
I was excited to find an air fryer in white. I don‚Äôt like cluttering my counter with appliances but this guy is staying! Quick easy healthy food!

I bought this primarily to make healthier fried tofu but have made French fries and cooked vegetables too for my vegitarian family. I recommend this product since it‚Äôs so well made and very safe to use.
We had this air fryer for 7 months and used it a handful of times. The convenience and the fries were great but I pulled it out to use recently and it no longer blows at all.

This was our first time at an Air Fryer and I liked it so much I bought another one for our over the road truck. I use it almost daily and love the crispy vegetables. The only downside is the overall size but to get the big cooking area I guess it is what it is.

I feel like a spokesperson for this item. I use it almost everyday. My only complaint is I can't put it in the dishwasher because I use it too much and don't run the dishwasher as often. Its extremely easy to use and everything comes out great. My only recommendation is a digital thermometer because you won't know if your meats are cooked properly.
It browned the breaded product, but no one in the world would think it had ever been fried. It looked like it had been baked in the oven without any oil. I returned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn‚Äôt last long at all! Went through 2 of them in 3 months. Just using it for the basics.

Too big for me, and threw too much heat the kept setting off the smake alarm

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast to cook & easy to clean
reviews.reviewText:
I was really surprised at how fast & crisp my chicken wings were in about 12 minutes
Clean up was easy
I even fixed a while 5# chicken in less than hour, meat was moist & tender, skin crisp

I got this amazing air-dry appliance...not knowing what I was using for.. it's very cute and I just love it. It is very easy to use and very easy to clean. My teenage daughter uses to heat left over pizza...and the pizza heats fast, the crust is crispy, and cheese melted...french fries come out delicious without the use of oil

reviews.reviewTitle: Love, Love, Love this air fryer!!!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use, reduces heat in kitchen, & cooks so quickly. Everything browns so evenly & quickly. Reheating left overs is a breeze & everything comes out so crispy.
I‚Äôve had this fryer for just over a month and it‚Äôs already broken. I loved it until it stopped working after 5 weeks of use. I do NOT recommend this fryer.
Love it! You can cook a whole chicken in it. The only thing is that you might want to add about 2oz of water at the bottom of the basket to help with keeping your food moist.
We love this air fryer. Very easy to use and clean. We did buy another air frying cookbook at Barnes and Noble and have been having fun trying new things.
for a family of 2 very nice size and very quiet, I really liked it but it was too small for 3, so after trying had to get a larger one.
Easy to use and clean. I make ribs, biscuits, meatloaf, etc. It doesn't heat up my house like the oven does which is a big plus in the summer.

I started off with the small dash air fryer and upgraded to this one about 6-8 months later. This one has much more room and I love it! I roasted a whole chicken in it, and it came out great. Works well for toasting bagels, too. Easy to use, easy to clean, and even looks cool on the counter.

I have 3 friends who own different air fry brands and they all agree mine is the best! They paid more for theirs. This air fry is also much larger in comparison to other brands. It‚Äôs just amazing! I use it weekly ...
Love finding new recipes to make. Easy to use simple clean up.
I love this air fryer! It is big enough to cook a whole chicken. Nice quality and made well! I am glad I purchased!

reviews.reviewTitle: I would not recommend this specific air fryer. It has rusted out only after 3 weeks of use.
reviews.reviewText: I would not recommend this specific air fryer. It has rusted out only after 3 weeks of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good for a family of four

AFTER ONLY USE FOR A SHORT WHILE THE PAINT INSIDE COMES OFF, ON BOTH THE TRAY AT THE BOTTOM AND MESHED BASKET...

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice looking and works for a family

Big basket, holds a lot of food. Seems to heat more evenly than some other air fryers I have used. Love the retro green.
Would buy again.
May have issues with this product. Will try it one more time before either keeping it or returning it.
This airfryer has changed my life. Cooking is so much more fun with this product! Time saver and can spend more time with my kids. Love it!
So far it has been working well, nice that it is fast. I have been using it for a lot of chicken nuggets & small potato products.
This air fryer is the perfect color for my kitchen & also larger than I expected which is great. I have been wanting to purchase one for s while now and I‚Äôm so glad I did!

This thing is awesome. I might have been the last person to jump on the Air Fryer bandwagon, but I‚Äôm glad I did. I just need to get the times right, but everything tastes good and it crisp like it was fried!
I bought this air fryer to replace a smaller one, this one is just excellent all around, I use it at least 2 times a week.
Worked great for the first two weeks and then the Teflon began flaking off. Still waiting for my replacement they promise me about 2 months ago. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best French fries and Salmon I ever cooked not together of course
reviews.reviewText: Awesome just simply awesome brought the 2Qt one for my niece and she loves it as well do yourself a favor and get an olive oil or vegetable spritzer
What an awesome gadget! I like to use it for veggies but it‚Äôll cook lots of things fast and clean up is a dream.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy this garbage horrible customer service terrible product!
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I don't usually do a lot of reviews but I felt hopefully someone will be saved a horrid headache in the future. We bought this unit and after less than six uses, yes I said six uses, the Teflon coating inside started bubbling and peeling. Less than a month, less than six uses its already falling apart. We would rinse it out with warm water and soap and wouldn't even scrub with an abrasive sponge! I reached out to customer service who said we don't sell parts but as a one time courtesy, ONE TIME, we will replace the unit. Oh but send yours back first then we will send you another one. Um what? Less than a month and you are doing me a favor? And I am supposed to take your word I will get a replacement if I send you mine? I was furious! What if some of the coating got on the food and one of our kids ate it? I was beyond mad. I asked again when would I get my replacement and was told once we receive yours we will send a replacement. $100 down the drain, what a waste. Never dealt with such sloppy customer service! I emailed them back but doubt I will get a response. And what box do I use? The original box is gone and this thing is a monster what will I send it back to you in? Please please don't buy this, very disappointing! There are similar reviews as well on here.

reviews.reviewTitle: Food is crunchy and looks yummy, but tastes like paint
reviews.reviewText:
Got this for my husband for Father‚Äôs Day. He‚Äôd been wanting an air fryer for a while.
PROS: very easy to use and clean. Uses less energy than an oven but you can cook in this just about anything you can cook in an oven. We made chicken nuggets with our own breading. They cooked quickly, weren‚Äôt greasy and they had a nice crunchy exterior and a good golden color.

CONS: The machine is enormous. Takes up way too much counter space. But I could get past that if it made delicious food. We washed the entire basket before the first use, but our meal came out with a horrible taste I can only compare to paint fumes. It was inedible. It‚Äôs a shame because I like everything else about the product (except the size) and the food LOOKED tasty and was crunchy, but the flavor was so off-putting we couldn‚Äôt eat what we were so excited to cook. It also made our whole house smell like burning plastic.

Overall, I‚Äôm kind of lazy and don‚Äôt want to return it until I‚Äôm SURE this wasn‚Äôt just a one-time thing due to it ‚Äúcooking off the new‚Äù and I will try one more, much smaller meal to see if there‚Äôs a difference. I‚Äôll update this review if I have better results.

UPDATE 9/26/2019 We have now cooked with this multiple times and the flavor and odor coming from the machine has improved but only marginally. We don‚Äôt enjoy the taste of anything that comes out of it. So I cannot recommend anyone purchase this, and ours will be going in the back of some deep cabinet where it‚Äôll sit for ten years until we finally have a yard sale.

reviews.reviewTitle: The easiest way to put food on the table, bar none. I'm in love with my air fryer!
reviews.reviewText:
This is a big, strong, and heavy appliance. It's a well-made air fryer.
Temperature goes up to 400, hot enough to broil perfectly.
Just set the time, temp., load it up, shake or turn if needed and get ready to feast.

My food gets cooked quickly, stays juicy and tender yet still gets a grilled-like crust on the outside.

Find a spot for this to reside in your kitchen, I use mine daily to feed my family, and they come running to the table asking what I've made.

After air frying, I don't like using my oven anymore, food just tastes better from my Dash.

I've so far tried pork chops, hard-cooked eggs (!) grilled cheese sandwiches, homemade French Fries, and each has been delicious, tasty and did I mention fast?

I'm keen to try making baked goods like muffins, cakes, and mini-pies.

My only minor disappointment is often needing to do a second batch.

But time goes by quickly when it's simply under 20 minutes for most foods.

This is my new workhorse for healthful easy meals.

I'm even making home-cooked meals more often, that's from a lazy procrastinator like me! I want to try cooking a whole chicken, too, and I've amassed a large collection of recipes from the internet.

Easy cooking, easy-cleaning, it runs whisper-quiet, and it's extremely easy to use.

I'm in love with my air fryer.

Don‚Äôt buy ! Non stick was peeling off after 3 months of light usage. Called manufacturer to do a warranty claim and she told me it would be coming via email. Never came. Tried doing it online. Got the weird response that they would replace it as a ‚Äúcourtesy‚Äù, not warranty. Said they would mail a shipping label. Never came. I donated it to charity. I replaced it with a cosori 5.8 qt and it‚Äôs great !

reviews.reviewTitle: Junk. Spend more for something better.
reviews.reviewText: So I‚Äôve owned this now since March 2019. It gets used 3 times a week. Well, the front panel of the fryer bin is broken, dangling from one side. But the biggest issue is, when you pull out the bin, the latch gives way and the bottom part unattaches from the basket and it falls to the floor making a terrible mess. So now when you pull out the fryer bin you have to support it with a hand mitt covered hand. Very annoying and hot! Spend more money for a better quality fryer. Very disappointed with this.

Of course now I have to order a new front cover because the plastic clips broke
